Use @ mathworks.com address for replies. Hello Team Captain, Thank you for registering for the MathWorks Minidrone Competition – India 2024! Upon successful registration, you should have received the complimentary license details along with the necessary instructions to download and install the software. Here are some important considerations if you encounter any issues (Download error with Sourcery G++) while installing the Simulink Support Package for Minidrones: Please Note: If you have already installed the necessary support package and started to work with MATLAB R2023b, please continue using it. Software Version: We recommend installing the R2024a version of our software. When you download the software, you will see a list of older versions on the right-hand side. Select R2024a to download this version. Download instructions are available here: MathWorks Central . Installing Simulink Support Package for Parrot Minidrones: You can use the following link to install the Support Package: Install Support for Parrot Minidrone . Accessing the Competition Model: You can access the parrotMinidroneCompetition model (to be used for the competition) by running the following command in MATLAB: parrotMinidroneCompetitionStart; For resources to help your team get started, check out the ‘Get Ready to Fly’ section on the competition webpage: MathWorks Minidrone Competition – India 2024 - MATLAB & Simulink and If you have any questions, you can reach out to us at minidronecompetition@mathworks.com . Wishing good luck to your team! -- Thanks, Manjunath Rajmohan Marketing Programs Event Specialist MathWorks Student Programs Team minidronecompetition@mathworks.com © 2024 The MathWorks, Inc. MATLAB and Simulink are registered trademarks of The MathWorks, Inc. See a list of additional trademarks . Other product or brand names may be trademarks or registered trademarks of their respective holders. subject: Welcome to MathWorks Minidrone Competition =?utf-8?b?4oCT?= India  2024
content: @go.mathworks.com is an unmonitored mailbox. Use @mathworks.com address for replies.         Hello Team Captain,    Thank you for registering for the MathWorks Minidrone Competition – India 2024!    Upon successful registration, you should have received the complimentary license details along with the necessary instructions to download and install the software. Here are some important considerations if you encounter any issues (Download error with Sourcery G++) while installing the Simulink Support Package for Minidrones:    Please Note: If you have already installed the necessary support package and started to work with MATLAB R2023b, please continue using it.  *Software Version:  *We recommend installing the R2024a version of our software. When you download the software, you will see a list of older versions on the right-hand side. Select R2024a to download this version.  *Download instructions are available here: MathWorks Central .    *Installing Simulink Support Package for Parrot Minidrones:  *You can use the following link to install the Support Package: Install Support for Parrot Minidrone .    *Accessing the Competition Model:  *You can access the parrotMinidroneCompetition model (to be used for the competition) by running the following command in MATLAB:    parrotMinidroneCompetitionStart;    For resources to help your team get started, check out the ‘Get Ready to Fly’ section on the competition webpage: MathWorks Minidrone Competition – India 2024 - MATLAB & Simulink and If you have any questions, you can reach out to us at minidronecompetition@mathworks.com .    Wishing good luck to your team!    --  Thanks,  Manjunath Rajmohan  Marketing Programs Event Specialist   MathWorks Student Programs Team  minidronecompetition@mathworks.com © 2024 The MathWorks, Inc.  MATLAB and Simulink are registered trademarks of The MathWorks, Inc. See a list of additional trademarks .  Other product or brand names may be trademarks or registered trademarks of their respective holders.    You are subscribed as 23dcs056@charusat.edu.in   Manage your email preferences or unsubscribe from our commercial email promotions. View our privacy policy .    MathWorks India Private Limited Trillium Building  Blocks I & J, Embassy Tech Village  Outer Ring Road  Bangalore, Karnataka 560103  India  Tel: +91 80 6632 6000  Fax: +91 80 6632 6010 Update from MathWorks @go.mathworks.com is an unmonitored mailbox. Use @mathworks.com address for replies. Hello Team Captain, Thank you for registering for the MathWorks Minidrone Competition – India 2024! Upon successful registration, you should have received the complimentary license details along with the necessary instructions to download and install the software. Here are some important considerations if you encounter any issues (Download error with Sourcery G++) while installing the Simulink Support Package for Minidrones: Please Note: If you have already installed the necessary support package and started to work with MATLAB R2023b, please continue using it. Software Version: We recommend installing the R2024a version of our software. When you download the software, you will see a list of older versions on the right-hand side. Select R2024a to download this version. Download instructions are available here: MathWorks Central . Installing Simulink Support Package for Parrot Minidrones: You can use the following link to install the Support Package: Install Support for Parrot Minidrone . Accessing the Competition Model: You can access the parrotMinidroneCompetition model (to be used for the competition) by running the following command in MATLAB: parrotMinidroneCompetitionStart; For resources to help your team get started, check out the ‘Get Ready to Fly’ section on the competition webpage: MathWorks Minidrone Competition – India 2024 - MATLAB & Simulink and If you have any questions, you can reach out to us at minidronecompetition@mathworks.com . Wishing good luck to your team! -- Thanks, Manjunath Rajmohan Marketing Programs Event Specialist MathWorks Student Programs Team minidronecompetition@mathworks.com © 2024 The MathWorks, Inc. subject: Re: CHATUSAT_FTE_CSE_Hackers Meet Up_ Securing the Cyber World:  Insights and Innovations _ 2/3/2024
content: Dear Students,  Thanks for attending the Expert Talk on "Securing the Cyber World: Insights and Innovations".  Please find your certificate of participation by clicking here. You may please access the certificate as per the sr. no. in the attachment. Access Your Certificates by Clicking Here. Contact the undersigned for any clarification.   On Tue, Feb 20, 2024 at 11:59 AM Dr. Kirti Makwana < kirtimakwana.mba@charusat.ac.in> wrote:  > Dear Students, > > We are excited to announce an upcoming event organized by the *Department > of Computer Science and Engineering*, DEPSTAR and CSPIT, FTE, CHARUSAT. > We cordially invite you to an expert talk on "Securing the Cyber World: > Insights and Innovations" featuring Mr. Onkar Sonawane, India's Youngest > Ethical Hacker under *Hackers MeetUp.* > > *Event Details:* > > *Date: March 2, 2024 (Saturday) * > > *Time: *11:00 AM - 01:00 PM > > *Venue:* CMPICA Auditorium, CMPICA Building > > *Mr. Onkar Sonawane* is renowned for his expertise and contributions to > the field of cybersecurity. As *India's Youngest Ethical Hacker | 2x TedX > Speaker | 2x Josh Talks Speaker, *Mr. Onkar brings valuable insights and > innovative approaches to safeguarding digital landscapes. > > During this talk, Mr. Sonawane will share his experiences, discuss > emerging trends, and provide valuable insights into the dynamic world of > cybersecurity. Whether you are a seasoned enthusiast or someone looking to > delve into the realm of cybersecurity, this event promises to be > enlightening and engaging for all. > > This event presents a unique opportunity to expand your knowledge and > interact with a leading figure in the cybersecurity domain. Patel, Assistant Professor, Department of Information Technology, Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR), CHARUSAT,  Changa    Dear Students,  We are excited to announce an upcoming event organized by the *Department of Computer Science and Engineering*, DEPSTAR and CSPIT, FTE, CHARUSAT. We cordially invite you to an expert talk on "Securing the Cyber World: Insights and Innovations" featuring Mr. Onkar Sonawane, India's Youngest Ethical Hacker under *Hackers MeetUp.*  *Event Details:*  *Date: March 2, 2024 (Saturday) *  *Time: *11:00 AM - 01:00 PM  *Venue:* CMPICA Auditorium, CMPICA Building  *Mr. Onkar Sonawane* is renowned for his expertise and contributions to the field of cybersecurity. During this talk, Mr. Sonawane will share his experiences, discuss emerging trends, and provide valuable insights into the dynamic world of cybersecurity. Whether you are a seasoned enthusiast or someone looking to delve into the realm of cybersecurity, this event promises to be enlightening and engaging for all.  This event presents a unique opportunity to expand your knowledge and interact with a leading figure in the cybersecurity domain. We encourage all students from CSPIT, DEPSTAR, and CMPICA to participate actively and make the most out of this enriching experience.  Please mark your calendars for March 2, 2024, and join us for this insightful session. *Kindly register yourself by clicking here. *  We look forward to your enthusiastic participation. content: Dear Students,  Greetings!!!  Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR) always believes that *Achievements (Academics)/Co-curricular Activities & Extra Co-curricular Activities/Competitive Exams* are equally important for the holistic development of students.  We always encourage students to take participation in various activities which are listed below:  1. *Technical *(hackathon/coding competition/web development competition/robot fight) *2*. *Non-Technical* (poster presentation/paper presentation/debate) *3*. *Cultural* (dance/singing/rangoli/mehndi/music competition/crafting/painting) 4. *Sports* (indoor games/outdoor games) *5*. *Competitive Exams*  You all are requested to enter the details of your achievement in the below-mentioned link by 01.04.2024, Thursday.   *Note :* 1. content: Dear Students,  Students who are willing to apply for the KYA can apply as per the university guidelines within three working days i.e. 11 | 12 and 16th January 2024.  Further, Supplementary Exam -1 (tentatively) shall be conducted from 23rd January. Detailed schedule shall be shared soon. subject: GSSOC24 Hiring Challenge
content: View this post on the web at https://gssoc.substack.com/p/gssoc24-hiring-challenge  Hello Everyone, Exciting news! GirlScript Summer of Code presents the GSSOC X ZS Hiring Challenge in collaboration with ZS Associates. 🤝 ZS Associates, a global leader in professional services  is hiring for three exciting roles: Decision Analytics Associate Business Technology Associate Data Science Associate Challenge Overview: The challenge is divided into 3 different categories. Detailed job descriptions and eligibility criteria for these roles can be found in the link below. Why Participate? Opportunity to Interview: The top performers of the challenge will get a chance to interview with the ZS team. 💯 Build Skills: Engage in innovative problem-solving and enhance your skill set. Make an Impact: Be part of a community that values and fosters growth and collaboration. Apply Now: Ready to take the next step in your career? Apply now through the application form [ https://substack.com/redirect/8a9c753a-76be-479b-9835-023b0d06e74c?j=eyJ1IjoiM3Yxd3RxIn0.pS6nfe3axVnbdKqBjOVXmoGAY01Y5n5tFxjxFZEfFWU ]. Let's Go! Don’t miss out on this incredible opportunity to advance your career and connect with like-minded professionals. 🚀🚀🚀🚀🚀 🌐 Stay Connected! Keep your eyes peeled on our social media channels for all the latest updates and announcements. We can't wait to see you there! GirlScript Summer of Code: GSSoC Website [ https://substack.com/redirect/a9222ed9-ad8e-45ea-b44b-6420d7174e86?j=eyJ1IjoiM3Yxd3RxIn0.pS6nfe3axVnbdKqBjOVXmoGAY01Y5n5tFxjxFZEfFWU ] YouTube Channel: GirlScript YouTube [ https://substack.com/redirect/ff8c9706-f273-43d8-bd09-df73c9c6dbcb?j=eyJ1IjoiM3Yxd3RxIn0.pS6nfe3axVnbdKqBjOVXmoGAY01Y5n5tFxjxFZEfFWU ] Need Help? If you have any questions or concerns, feel free to connect with us at zshiring@girlscript.tech [ https://substack.com/redirect/fba57d9a-7f88-4b3f-a47d-bdb953abe00c?j=eyJ1IjoiM3Yxd3RxIn0.pS6nfe3axVnbdKqBjOVXmoGAY01Y5n5tFxjxFZEfFWU ] Warm regards, GirlScript GSSOC Team [ https://substack.com/redirect/a3ce2c08-6f8d-4885-9c5e-d63876a0c641?j=eyJ1IjoiM3Yxd3RxIn0.pS6nfe3axVnbdKqBjOVXmoGAY01Y5n5tFxjxFZEfFWU ]  Unsubscribe https://substack.com/redirect/2/eyJlIjoiaHR0cHM6Ly9nc3NvYy5zdWJzdGFjay5jb20vYWN0aW9uL2Rpc2FibGVfZW1haWw_.jWVL2MpyVPEVJ5gz4lAV4PkrKxqPIcOZ84_Wh1IZRIo? subject: Regarding your absent in HS205.02 - Media and Graphic Design Workshop
content: Dear Students,  It is found that you have remained absent in the Media and Graphic Design (HS205.02) course workshop on Day-1 i.e. March 5, 2024.  Strictly note that it is mandatory for you to attend the Media and Graphic Design course (March 5-7, 2024) and complete all assignments, tasks, activities given and appear for University Internal &  External Exam on March 7, 2024.  Non-compliance to the above and further absence in any session may result in an FF Grade/Backlog in this course. Kindly take note of the same and remain present for the remaining days of the workshop.  In case of any concern, reply to this email.  With regards,  Dr. Kaushik Trivedi CHARUSAT Mob. 9265620055  --    DISCLAIMER: The information transmitted is intended only for the person or entity to which it is addressed and may contain confidential and/or privileged material which is the intellectual property of Charotar  University of Science & Technology (CHARUSAT). Any review, retransmission, dissemination or other use of, or taking of any action in reliance upon  this information by persons or entities other than the intended recipient  is strictly prohibited. If you are not the intended recipient, or the  employee, or agent responsible for delivering the message to the intended  recipient and/or if you have received this in error, please contact the  sender and delete the material from the computer or device. CHARUSAT does  not take any liability or responsibility for any malicious codes/software  and/or viruses/Trojan horses that may have been picked up during the  transmission of this message. By opening and solely relying on the contents  or part thereof this message, and taking action thereof, the recipient  relieves the CHARUSAT of all the liabilities including any damages done to  the recipient's pc/laptop/peripherals and other communication devices due  to any reason. subject: Fwd: Inviting Applications for NIDHI Entrepreneur in Residence (EiR)  Program | GUSEC, Gujarat University
content: Dear Students,  Greetings from GUSEC!  GUSEC is inviting applications for the *NIDHI Entrepreneur in Residence (EiR) Program *supported by the Department of Science and Technology, Government of India.  This scheme is particularly for those who have a basic degree or diploma in science or engineering. The shortlisted students will get grant support up to *INR 3.6 lakhs for a year* along with mentoring, networking & utilization of coworking space for prototyping work.  To know more about the scheme, students can visit the *website: gusec.in/eir24 *  Interested students are requested to reach out to below-mentioned faculty members:  DCE - Prof. Janardan Bharwad DCS - Dr. Nilesh Dubey DIT - Prof. Akash Patel   --  Dr. Jaimin N Undavia, Associate Professor & Coordinator, CHARUSAT STARTUP AND INNOVATION CELL, Faculty of Computer Science and Applications, CHANGA M: 9426923708, 7283968701 Ext: 5250  --    DISCLAIMER: The information transmitted is intended only for the person or entity to which it is addressed and may contain confidential and/or privileged material which is the intellectual property of Charotar  University of Science & Technology (CHARUSAT). Any review, retransmission, dissemination or other use of, or taking of any action in reliance upon  this information by persons or entities other than the intended recipient  is strictly prohibited. subject: =?UTF-8?Q?Fwd=3A_The_launch_event_of_AICTE=2D_VAANI_=28Vibrant_Advoc?= 	=?UTF-8?Q?acy_for_amplifying_Native_Indian_Languages=29_=E2=80=93_Financial_Gr?= 	=?UTF-8?Q?ant_to_conduct_Seminar=2FWorkshop=2FConference_in_Regional_Langu?= 	=?UTF-8?Q?ages_=2D_8th_March_2024_at_12_=3A15_PM=2E?=
content: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: AICTE(no-reply) Date: Thu, Mar 7, 2024 at 2:31 PM Subject: The launch event of AICTE- VAANI (Vibrant Advocacy for amplifying Native Indian Languages) – Financial Grant to conduct Seminar/Workshop/Conference in Regional Languages - 8th March 2024 at 12 :15 PM. To:  *Dear Sir/Madam*  The communication in regional languages  is vital for effective developmental action. According to the Census of India, 122 major languages and 1599 other languages out of which 30 languages are spoken by over a million native speakers in different parts of India. Disseminating knowledge and strengthening the learning process through the medium of regional languages thus becomes a necessity to achieve the Viksit Bharat latest by 2047.  All India Council for Technical Education is launching a scheme titled *AICTE- VAANI* (Vibrant Advocacy for amplifying Native Indian Languages). Scheme provides financial assistance to the councils approved institutions to conduct Conference/Seminar/Workshop of minimum 02days to maximum 03 days in the topics of Emerging technologies through any of the widely used 12 Regional languages.  *Prof. TG Sitharam*, Chairman AICTE will launch *AICTE VAANI *on *8th March 2024 at 12:15pm*. *Padmashri* *Prof Chaamu Krishna Sasthri*, Chairman , Bharathiya Bhasha Samithi shall grace the occasion as the Guest of Honor.  You are hereby requested to encourage the faculty members and students of your good institution to attend the launch event through the link https://www.youtube.com/mediaaicte .  PFA Attached Banner.  PFA:- https://drive.google.com/file/d/1AskfB8KvFvnd61cG7bliBpsLouQS_PNl/view?usp=sharing    *With Regards* *Dr. Ramesh Unnikrishnan,* *Advisor-II, Training and Learning Bureau,* *All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE)* *New Delhi-110070**Tel: 011-29581215*  --    DISCLAIMER: The information transmitted is intended only for the person or entity to which it is addressed and may contain confidential and/or privileged material which is the intellectual property of Charotar  University of Science & Technology (CHARUSAT). Naina Parmar, Assistant Professor, Computer Science & Engineering Department, Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR) Changa-Gujarat 388421   ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal DEPSTAR Date: Thu, Mar 28, 2024 at 1:28 PM Subject: Fwd: Free Generative AI Courses for Beginners from Google, Microsoft and More 👇🏻 To: Depstar ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Team NSN Date: Wed, Mar 27, 2024 at 11:35 PM Subject: Free Generative AI Courses for Beginners from Google, Microsoft and More 👇🏻 To: Amit View in browser *Free Generative AI Courses for Beginners*  Generative AI (Gen AI) isn’t just a techy buzzword anymore. From composing captivating content with ChatGPT to streamlining code with Microsoft Copilot, AI is rapidly transforming every industry – and even your workday.  However, here’s the secret: to truly leverage the full potential of these AI tools, you need to understand the basics. Don’t worry, you don’t have to become an AI engineer! This guide will introduce you to a selection of free Gen AI courses designed specifically for beginners.  By enrolling, you’ll not only learn the core concepts behind these powerful tools, but also develop essential skills like effective prompting, efficient research, asking the right questions, and analyzing information like a pro.  So, here are a few free courses to help you get started with your Gen AI journey. Click here to read more! It might also interest you to read: *5 Ways Generative AI is Reshaping Jobs in 2024 *  *We’d love to hear how you’re putting these Gen AI tools to use! Share your experiences and ask any questions you might have*. ------------------------------  *If you're using Gmail, move our emails from 'Promotions' to 'Primary' to stay updated!*   National Skills Network - NSN  contact@nationalskillsnetwork.com  NSN Digital Solutions Pvt Ltd. subject: Quiz 2 | Engineering Physics - 2 | PY143
content: Google Forms   Thanks for filling out Quiz 2 | Engineering Physics - 2 | PY143 Here's what was received.   Quiz 2 | Engineering Physics - 2 | PY143  Syllabus: Experiment 1, 2, 3, and 4   Email *   23dcs056@charusat.edu.in   Name *   Vansh Malani   Student ID No. *   23dcs056   Institute - Deparmtment *   DEPSTAR - CS    Quiz 2 | Engineering Physics - 2 | PY143   Which of the following statements is true regarding the sensitivity of a   Wien bridge circuit for capacitance measurement? *   Higher sensitivity is achieved with lower values of resistance and   capacitance   Higher sensitivity is achieved with higher values of resistance and   capacitance   Sensitivity is not affected by resistance or capacitance values   Sensitivity depends only on the frequency of oscillation   Which parameter is usually adjusted to balance a Wien bridge circuit during   capacitance measurement? *   Capacitance   Inductance   Voltage   Resistance   In a Wien bridge circuit, how does the balance condition affect the voltage   at the output? *   Voltage is zero   Voltage is maximum   Voltage is minimum   Voltage is constant   Which of these is a disadvantage of the Wien Bridge oscillator?  *   It cannot fabricate a pure tune   Distortion observed in output is high   It cannot be used for high-resistance values   There is no automatic gain control   In an AC bridge circuit, what type of impedance is typically measured?  *   Purely resistive   Purely capacitive   Purely inductive   Complex impedance containing resistance, capacitance, and/or inductance   In a series LCR circuit, Capacitive reactance (XC) = Inductive reactance   (XL) then circuit ___________.  *   is capacitive   is at resonance   is inductive   draws minimum current   In the "Study of Resonance in LCR circuit" experiment, the range of the   frequency oscillator was fixed to ____________. *   20Hz to 200Hz   200Hz to 2KHz   2KHz to 20KHz   20KHz to 200KHz   Identify the experiment from the apparatus given below. * Captionless Image   Experiment No. 1 (Cx)   Experiment No. 2 (LCR)   Experiment No. 3 (RC)   Experiment No. 4 (Bx)   In the LCR circuit experiment, if resistance in the circuit increases then   _____________.  *   the peak of the resonance decreases.   capacitance decreases.   current through the circuit increases.   it does not affect the current.   How does increasing the capacitance in an LCR circuit affect the resonant   frequency?  *   Resonant frequency increases   Resonant frequency decreases   Resonant frequency remains constant   Resonant frequency fluctuates randomly   Consider a circuit where R and C are connected in series with a DC source,   such that R is zero ohms. In that scenario, the time constant of the   circuit would be?  *   Zero   Infinity   Infinitesimal   None of the above   If the value of the capacitance of a capacitor in a series RC circuit   increases, then the time required to reach the saturation voltage across   the capacitor would  *   Remain same   Increase   Decrease   None of the above   Current in the series RC circuit connected to a DC source, during charging:  *   Increases monotonously with time   Decreases monotonously with time   Remains same   None of the above   In a series RC circuit connected to a DC source, the time constant is   defined as the time (during discharging) when, *   Current/voltage drops to ln(e) times the initial value (ln: natural Log)   Current/voltage drops to e times the initial value   Current/voltage drops to e^2 times the initial value   Current/voltage drops to 1/e times the initial value   Consider the following situations: (1) two capacitors connected in parallel with each other and then in series   with a resistor having resistance R. (2) Two capacitors are connected in series with each other and then in   series with the same resistor as above. Then:  *   The time constant of situation (1) would be greater than situation (2)   The time constant of the situation (2) would be greater than situation (1)   The time constant would be the same   None of the above   If the diameter of a coil is increased, what happens to the density of the   magnetic field lines inside the coil? *   Increases   Decreases   Remains the same   Disappears   If the diameter of a coil is doubled while maintaining the same current,   what happens to the magnetic field strength at its center?  *   It doubles   It halves   It quadruples   It remains the same   When comparing two coils with different diameters and aligned perpendicular   to Earth's magnetic field lines, which coil will experience a stronger   total magnetic field?  *   Coil with a larger diameter   Coil with a smaller diameter   It depends on the material of the coil   Both coils will experience the same magnetic field strength   Biot-Savart's Law is used to determine the:  *   The electric field around a charged particle   Magnetic field around a current-carrying conductor   The force between two charged particles   The potential difference across a resistor   According to Biot-Savart's Law, the magnetic field (B) produced by a   current element (dl) is:   Directly proportional to the current (I) and inversely proportional to the   distance from the current element (r)   Inversely proportional to the current (I) and directly proportional to the   distance from the current element (r)   Directly proportional to the current (I) and the distance from the current   element (r)   Inversely proportional to the current (I) and the distance from the current   element (r)   Create your own Google Form  Report Abuse Thanks for filling out Quiz 2 | Engineering Physics - 2 | PY143 Here's what was received. Quiz 2 | Engineering Physics - 2 | PY143 Syllabus: Experiment 1, 2, 3, and 4 Email * 23dcs056@charusat.edu.in Name * Vansh Malani Student ID No. * 23dcs056 Institute - Deparmtment * DEPSTAR - CS Quiz 2 | Engineering Physics - 2 | PY143 Which of the following statements is true regarding the sensitivity of a Wien bridge circuit for capacitance measurement? * Higher sensitivity is achieved with lower values of resistance and capacitance Higher sensitivity is achieved with higher values of resistance and capacitance Sensitivity is not affected by resistance or capacitance values Sensitivity depends only on the frequency of oscillation Which parameter is usually adjusted to balance a Wien bridge circuit during capacitance measurement? * Capacitance Inductance Voltage Resistance In a Wien bridge circuit, how does the balance condition affect the voltage at the output? * Voltage is zero Voltage is maximum Voltage is minimum Voltage is constant Which of these is a disadvantage of the Wien Bridge oscillator? * It cannot fabricate a pure tune Distortion observed in output is high It cannot be used for high-resistance values There is no automatic gain control In an AC bridge circuit, what type of impedance is typically measured? * Purely resistive Purely capacitive Purely inductive Complex impedance containing resistance, capacitance, and/or inductance In a series LCR circuit, Capacitive reactance (XC) = Inductive reactance (XL) then circuit ___________. * is capacitive is at resonance is inductive draws minimum current In the "Study of Resonance in LCR circuit" experiment, the range of the frequency oscillator was fixed to ____________. * 20Hz to 200Hz 200Hz to 2KHz 2KHz to 20KHz 20KHz to 200KHz Identify the experiment from the apparatus given below. * Experiment No. 1 (Cx) Experiment No. 2 (LCR) Experiment No. 3 (RC) Experiment No. 4 (Bx) In the LCR circuit experiment, if resistance in the circuit increases then _____________. * the peak of the resonance decreases. capacitance decreases. current through the circuit increases. it does not affect the current. How does increasing the capacitance in an LCR circuit affect the resonant frequency? * Resonant frequency increases Resonant frequency decreases Resonant frequency remains constant Resonant frequency fluctuates randomly Consider a circuit where R and C are connected in series with a DC source, such that R is zero ohms. In that scenario, the time constant of the circuit would be? * Zero Infinity Infinitesimal None of the above If the value of the capacitance of a capacitor in a series RC circuit increases, then the time required to reach the saturation voltage across the capacitor would * Remain same Increase Decrease None of the above Current in the series RC circuit connected to a DC source, during charging: * Increases monotonously with time Decreases monotonously with time Remains same None of the above In a series RC circuit connected to a DC source, the time constant is defined as the time (during discharging) when, * Current/voltage drops to ln(e) times the initial value (ln: natural Log) Current/voltage drops to  e times the initial value Current/voltage drops to  e^2 times the initial value Current/voltage drops to  1/e times the initial value Consider the following situations: (1) two capacitors connected in parallel with each other and then in series with a resistor having resistance R. (2) Two capacitors are connected in series with each other and then in series with the same resistor as above. Then: * The time constant of situation (1) would be greater than situation (2) The time constant of the situation (2) would be greater than situation (1) The time constant would be the same None of the above If the diameter of a coil is increased, what happens to the density of the magnetic field lines inside the coil? * Increases Decreases Remains the same Disappears If the diameter of a coil is doubled while maintaining the same current, what happens to the magnetic field strength at its center? * It doubles It halves It quadruples It remains the same When comparing two coils with different diameters and aligned perpendicular to Earth's magnetic field lines, which coil will experience a stronger total magnetic field? * Coil with a larger diameter Coil with a smaller diameter It depends on the material of the coil Both coils will experience the same magnetic field strength Biot-Savart's Law is used to determine the: * The electric field around a charged particle Magnetic field around a current-carrying conductor The force between two charged particles The potential difference across a resistor According to Biot-Savart's Law, the magnetic field ( B ) produced by a current element ( dl ) is: Directly proportional to the current (I) and inversely proportional to the distance from the current element (r) Inversely proportional to the current (I) and directly proportional to the distance from the current element (r) Directly proportional to the current (I) and the distance from the current element (r) Inversely proportional to the current (I) and the distance from the current element (r) Create your own Google Form Report Abuse

subject: Fwd: MA144 (Section 2) online lecture link
content: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Dr. Rajendra B. Chauhan Date: Fri, Apr 12, 2024 at 2:40 PM Subject: MA144 (Section 2) online lecture link To:   Dear students,  The online lecture for MA144 (Engineering Mathematics II) is scheduled on 13.04.24, Saturday *from 11.00 am to 12.30 pm* for the second semester students of IT, CE and CSE branches. We will be discussing the topics of elementary probability: Joint and conditional probability and the Bayes theorem from *Unit 6*. Kindly join the lecture using the following link without fail.  https://teams.microsoft.com/l/meetup-join/19%3ameeting_ZmViZWE4YzMtNDc2YS00MmQyLThjOWMtNzUzYmU5MmM0Y2Jl%40thread.v2/0?context=%7b%22Tid%22%3a%228dbd2884-120c-413b-80b2-1117dd3469a4%22%2c%22Oid%22%3a%223ed35552-5e3c-4b13-916a-3622e7a12052%22%7d  If necessary, kindly download the Microsoft teams to join the lecture. content: Dear all, As our workshop was rescheduled to 1st and 2nd March, which is already conveyed in the whatsapp group. subject: Fwd: Unlock 1900+ Internship Opportunities for Your Students with Top Brands
content: A good opportunity is knocking your door!         ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Internshala Date: Wed, Jul 3, 2024 at 3:06 PM Subject: Unlock 1900+ Internship Opportunities for Your Students with Top Brands To:   Dear Sir/Ma'am,  Greetings from Internshala!  We are excited to inform you about the launch of our new campaign ‘*Intern with big brands*' that features *1900+ internships *with big brands like *Zomato, ClearTax, PhonePe* *and many more*. The internships are in profiles like *marketing, technology, science, finance* and more, an incredible chance for your students to kickstart their career.  *How can Cspit participate?*  1. Register your college here - *internshala.com/i/bigbrands-db* . The last date to participate is *8th July, 2024*. 2. Share the details of your students, and we will create a free Internshala account for them, enabling access to a wide range of job opportunities.  *What’s in it for your students?*     - Stipend up to *₹60,000/month*    - A prestigious internship certificate    - No previous skills or experience required  *Eligibility Criteria* *-* Students from all years and various profiles looking to start their careers with big brands are eligible to apply for these internships.  *Note - *Participation is free of charge; please do not share this email with students as only college faculty members should complete the registration form. } table { border: 0; border-collapse: collapse; border-spacing: 0; mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; } table, td, th{ mso-table-lspace: 0pt; mso-table-rspace: 0pt; } /* Remove spacing between tables in Outlook 2007 and up */ table tr, table td, table th { border-collapse: collapse; } .ExternalClass{ width: 100%; } /* Force Hotmail to display emails at full width */ .ExternalClass, .ExternalClass p, .ExternalClass span, .ExternalClass font, .ExternalClass td, .ExternalClass th, .ExternalClass div { line-height: 100%; content: Sow today for a better tomorrow.  Plant a tree at your nearby place and live in a better environment. Participate in National Students Paryavaran Competition (NSPC) using https://ecomitram.app/nspc24 and upload a selfie to get certificate.   Regards, Radhika H. Patel, Assistant Professor, Department of Information Technology, Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR), CHARUSAT,  Changa  ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Head CE Depstar Date: Fri, 12 Jul 2024, 1:29 pm Subject: Fwd: Participation in National Students Paryavaran Competition (NSPC). With climate change causing devastating impacts worldwide, it’s crucial to engage our students in meaningful environmental initiatives. In this regard, following quiz is initiated by NSPC: *Event Details:*     - *Theme:* “Sowing to Growing”    - *Dates:*       - Registration: From 1st July, 2024, to 21st August, 2024: Link: NSPC       Registration       - Quiz Competition: 1st July, 2024, to 21st August, 2024       - Result Announcement: 30th August, 2024  *Link for online quiz* competition for students to participate in the competition https://ecomitram.app/nspc24 Link will be active only From 1st July-2024 to 21st August-2024.  Kindly circulate it to students and ask them to participate in the quiz | certificates received should be uploaded on e-governance and ask them to update their batch counselors too | Batch counselors will update the count of Ms. Kinjal (Coordinator| counseling team) about the number of students who participated.  A sample of certificate will be displayed on digital TV  Thank You  ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal DEPSTAR Date: Fri, Jul 12, 2024 at 10:16 AM Subject: Fwd: Participation in National Students Paryavaran Competition (NSPC). View it in your mobile/ web browser ------------------------------  Respected Sir/ Madam,  *Greetings from AICTE!*  As you may be aware, the National Students Paryavaran Competition (NSPC) is an initiative supported by the Ministry of Environment, Forest & Climate Change, GoI. With climate change causing devastating impacts worldwide, it’s crucial to engage our students in meaningful environmental initiatives.  NSPC provides an opportunity for students to acquire knowledge, skills, and attitudes necessary to address environmental challenges.  The competition aims to raise awareness about environmental challenges and foster innovative solutions among our youth.   *Event Details:*     - *Theme:* “Sowing to Growing”    - *Dates:*       - Registration: From 1st July, 2024, to 21st August, 2024: Link: NSPC       Registration       - Quiz Competition: 1st July, 2024, to 21st August, 2024       - Result Announcement: 30th August, 2024   You are requested to disseminate the information about NSPC and encourage students to participate in the competition scheduled from 1st July 2024 to 21st August 2024 and contribute to a greener and more sustainable future. The participation is free for all students. There is no commercial activity involved in this awareness campaign a copy of the detailed program of the competition is enclosed.  Let’s empower our students to create a greener, safer planet. Together, we can make a difference! subject: STUDENTS ARE INVITED FOR SUMMER PLACEMENT TRAINING AND INTERNSHIP @  TOP MNC's
content: *Dear Students,*  *Congratulations on being shortlisted for our prestigious Internship Program!*    *We are excited to announce the launch of our 2-Month Training + Internship program, organized by Teachnook's in collaboration with IIT Roorkee Cognizance and designed by IBM.Here's a detailed overview of the program:*  *First Month: Training:* -  *Engage in IBM training through live lectures and benefit from mentorship by industry professionals.- Gain access to the IBM Portal for interactions with trainers and peers.- Receive login credentials upon registration to begin your learning journey.*  *Second Month: Internship:* - * Participate in an internship with live mentorship, working on real-world projects under professional guidance.- This practical experience will enhance your understanding of industry practices and hone your skills.*  * Projects:* -  *Minor Project: An individual project to demonstrate your skills and creativity. Dedicated sessions will help you build and enhance your resume.- Major Project: Collaborate with a team of 15 interns on a group project. You will be assigned specific responsibilities, and the company will provide the necessary data and materials.* *Third Month: Evaluation and Opportunities:* -  *Based on your performance, you will undergo a technical interview within the same company.- A successful interview could lead to a stipend-based internship opportunity.* *Program Completion Benefits:* -          *Comprehensive training from Basic to Advanced Concepts.- Guaranteed Internship opportunity.- 3+ Accredited Certificates with Wipro verification.- Placement Assistance.- Completion of at least 3 Industry-based projects.- Letter of Recommendation from Project Heads.- Mock Interviews and Group Discussions for Placement Preparation.- Access to live and recorded sessions.- 24/7 Exclusive support.- Doubt/Query support through live sessions.* *Don’t miss this incredible opportunity to jumpstart your career!!!*  *Apply now:* *[https://forms.gle/bPJXZhPHiifnYxoc9 ]* *For more information and updates, join our official WhatsApp group*: * [https://chat.whatsapp.com/D1Oscfo00MjImVP4P3z67d ]*      * Top Preferred Courses:- Artificial Intelligence- Data Science- Machine Learning- Cloud Computing- Full Stack Web Development*  *We look forward to welcoming you to our program and guiding you towards a successful career.*  *Thank You* Dear Students, Congratulations on being shortlisted for our prestigious Internship Program! We are excited to announce the launch of our 2-Month Training + Internship program, organized by Teachnook's in collaboration with IIT Roorkee Cognizance and designed by IBM. Here's a detailed overview of the program: First Month: Training: - Engage in IBM training through live lectures and benefit from mentorship by industry professionals. - Gain access to the IBM Portal for interactions with trainers and peers. - Receive login credentials upon registration to begin your learning journey. Second Month: Internship: - Participate in an internship with live mentorship, working on real-world projects under professional guidance. - This practical experience will enhance your understanding of industry practices and hone your skills. Projects: - Minor Project: An individual project to demonstrate your skills and creativity. Dedicated sessions will help you build and enhance your resume. - Major Project: Collaborate with a team of 15 interns on a group project. You will be assigned specific responsibilities, and the company will provide the necessary data and materials. Third Month: Evaluation and Opportunities: - Based on your performance, you will undergo a technical interview within the same company. - A successful interview could lead to a stipend-based internship opportunity. Program Completion Benefits: - Comprehensive training from Basic to Advanced Concepts. - Guaranteed Internship opportunity. - 3+ Accredited Certificates with Wipro verification. - Placement Assistance. - Completion of at least 3 Industry-based projects. - Letter of Recommendation from Project Heads. - Mock Interviews and Group Discussions for Placement Preparation. - Access to live and recorded sessions. - 24/7 Exclusive support. - Doubt/Query support through live sessions. Don’t miss this incredible opportunity to jumpstart your career!!! Apply now: [ https://forms.gle/bPJXZhPHiifnYxoc9 ] For more information and updates, join our official WhatsApp group : [ https://chat.whatsapp.com/D1Oscfo00MjImVP4P3z67d ] Top Preferred Courses: - Artificial Intelligence - Data Science - Machine Learning - Cloud Computing - Full Stack Web Development We look forward to welcoming you to our program and guiding you towards a successful career. Thank You

subject: Fwd: NEW eLearning Format - Virtual Training on AI and ML in Chip Design
content: [image: AI and ML in Chip Design] In today's fast-paced technological landscape, Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) techniques are revolutionizing chip design methodologies. Integrated-circuit (IC) chip companies and engineers have unprecedented opportunities to use these technologies to enhance product quality across crucial dimensions such as speed, energy efficiency, and cost. This, in turn, allows for meeting goals with reduced engineering resources and accelerated time-to-market.  IEEE invites you to a two-day live, virtual training, *Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) in Chip Design* with subject matter expert, Andrew B. Kahng, Distinguished Professor of CSE and ECE at University of California, San Diego (UCSD).  *Day 1: 13 August 2024 12-2pm ET *  *Day 2: 14 August 2024 12-2pm ET*  This comprehensive virtual training will equip engineers with the:     - Essential knowledge to leverage AI and ML effectively in chip design    and EDA,    - Understanding of the rationale behind these technological shifts to    identifying high-value applications and selecting relevant AI and ML    technologies, and    - Insights into optimizing design methods and preparing for the future    of chip design.  Attendees of the virtual training will have the opportunity for first-hand interaction with Professor Kahng to ask questions during the interactive portion of the training. *Learn More* *Note, this live event is part of the 2024 IEEE eLearning course program of the same title. The content will be loaded into IEEE *Xplore* and the IEEE Learning Network after the live event for your team to access in the future. [image: IEEE Logo] [image: LinkedIn Icon] [image: Facebook Icon] [image: Instagram Icon] [image: Twitter Icon] [image: YouTube Icon] IEEE – 445 Hoes Lane, Piscataway, NJ 08854 USA - ieeexplore.ieee.org Copyright © 2024 IEEE. All rights reserved. This e-mail was sent to *principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in *. If you no longer wish to receive IEEE *Xplore* and related product e-mails you may *unsubscribe * at any time.  --  You received this message because you are subscribed to the Google Groups "Depstar_CSE" group. To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to depstar_cse+unsubscribe@charusat.ac.in. To view this discussion on the web visit https://groups.google.com/a/charusat.ac.in/d/msgid/depstar_cse/CALCYB4v6NaXZh%2B3_KhmYFR6wqUK4AtgaLCvg9cwCAoE7Ou-%2BJA%40mail.gmail.com .  --    DISCLAIMER: The information transmitted is intended only for the person or entity to which it is addressed and may contain confidential and/or privileged material which is the intellectual property of Charotar  University of Science & Technology (CHARUSAT). Integrated-circuit (IC) chip companies and engineers have unprecedented opportunities to use these technologies to enhance product quality across crucial dimensions such as speed, energy efficiency, and cost. This, in turn, allows for meeting goals with reduced engineering resources and accelerated time-to-market. IEEE invites you to a two-day live, virtual training, Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) in Chip Design with subject matter expert, Andrew B. Kahng, Distinguished Professor of CSE and ECE at University of California, San Diego (UCSD). Day 1: 13 August 2024 12-2pm ET Day 2: 14 August 2024 12-2pm ET This comprehensive virtual training will equip engineers with the: Essential knowledge to leverage AI and ML effectively in chip design and EDA, Understanding of the rationale behind these technological shifts to identifying high-value applications and selecting relevant AI and ML technologies, and Insights into optimizing design methods and preparing for the future of chip design. Attendees of the virtual training will have the opportunity for first-hand interaction with Professor Kahng to ask questions during the interactive portion of the training. Learn More *Note, this live event is part of the 2024 IEEE eLearning course program of the same title. The content will be loaded into IEEE Xplore and the IEEE Learning Network after the live event for your team to access in the future. IEEE – 445 Hoes Lane, Piscataway, NJ 08854 USA - ieeexplore.ieee.org Copyright © 2024 IEEE. All rights reserved. This e-mail was sent to principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in . content: Dear Cyber Enthusiasts,  Please go through the trailing mail.  regards,  ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Cyber Kavach Date: Wed, Mar 20, 2024 at 3:40 PM Subject: You are Invited! 👩‍💻 Join us for Cybersecurity LevelUp 🕵‍♀️ with TheHackersMeetup  Get ready to dive into the digital deep end with the coolest cyber sleuths in town at *The Hackers Meetup Charusat!*   "The future of technology is female. With women leading in tech, we're not just breaking barriers; we're rewriting the code of possibility." - Reshma Saujani (ceo girls who code)  >From Ada Lovelace's visionary algorithms to Grace Hopper's pioneering contributions, our journey is rooted in their remarkable achievements. Now, it's our turn to carry the torch forward. Join us in the *women's day special edition* of TheHackersMeetup.  Thrilling sessions await us:  Cybersecurity Zero to Hero by *Niral Shekhat (eJPT certified)*  Don't forget to bring your laptops for the *Capture The Flag* competition 🎯 Pssttt.. we have stickers :)   *Register Now: **lu.ma/thm.cu2* 🗓 *️Date*: 21/03/2024 ⏰ *Time*: 02:10 PM to 04:10 AM 📍 *Venue*: 638, AIML Lab, 2nd floor, A7 building, CHARUSAT, Changa  "Event if always Free for all, Open for all"  *Limited seats available. Entries will be closed after 50 registrations.*  Certificate of participation will be provided ✅  *Don't forget to bring your laptops to participate in the Capture The Flag competition. Exciting prizes are waiting for you!*  This isn't your average tech talk; it's a party with a purpose! Whether you're a seasoned hacker or just curious about the world of cybersecurity, you'll find plenty to get excited about.  *By the Hackers For the Hackers - "Happy Hacking"*  So mark your calendars, bring your A-game, and let's make some waves in the digital universe together. Don't miss out on this electrifying opportunity to network with fellow tech enthusiasts and learn from the best in the biz. content: View this post on the web at https://gssoc.substack.com/p/leaderboard-is-live  Dear Contributors, We hope this newsletter finds you well. We have some important updates and news to share regarding the GirlScript Summer of Code program. Your dedication and hard work are what make this program a success, and we want to keep you informed every step of the way. Leaderboard Update Our team has detected some unusual activity on the leaderboard. To maintain the integrity and fairness of the competition, we are conducting a thorough review. Here are the key points you need to know: Leaderboard updates: Leaderboard updates 2 times a day automatically.  How Score is calculated: Score is calculated based on the label assigned on the particular repository and all the PR is made transparent on leaderboard to avoid spams. So anyone can look into your contribution and report spam. So make sure correct labels has been done.  This review is a technical necessity, and we appreciate your patience and understanding. More details about leaderboard: https://github.com/GSSoC24/ [ https://link.sbstck.com/redirect/9237aad0-be9a-47dd-b3b6-ed8dbf3bfced?j=eyJ1IjoiM3Yxd3RxIn0.pS6nfe3axVnbdKqBjOVXmoGAY01Y5n5tFxjxFZEfFWU ] Learn how to contribute by watch this YouTube video:  [ https://link.sbstck.com/redirect/50bcd2da-cd4d-454e-9cd9-b9491f7eec44?j=eyJ1IjoiM3Yxd3RxIn0.pS6nfe3axVnbdKqBjOVXmoGAY01Y5n5tFxjxFZEfFWU ] We know you might have some issue regarding your points, raise your issue by clicking on the link to GitHub discussion. Get GitHub badge by answering the questions  [ https://link.sbstck.com/redirect/941070c4-7532-42ee-97de-81bb89b80acd?j=eyJ1IjoiM3Yxd3RxIn0.pS6nfe3axVnbdKqBjOVXmoGAY01Y5n5tFxjxFZEfFWU ] Spotlight on Contributors We would like to take this opportunity to highlight some of the amazing contributions made by our participants so far: Innovative Solutions: Several contributors have come up with creative and effective solutions to complex problems. Collaboration: The spirit of teamwork and collaboration has been phenomenal. Mentorship: Many of you have stepped up to help and mentor fellow contributors, fostering a supportive community. One last note: Make sure you PR has the following, we noticed some of the PA not assigned labels, we are in touch with them to get it fixed asap. Event the PR is merged once its labelled leaderboard will count on next server run which takes 24 hrs to update. Make sure its merged. Assigned to your name Correct labels is assigned, gssoc, level3 or level2 or level1 Thank You! Thank you for your cooperation and continued contributions. By working together to improve our labelling practices, we can enhance our project management and make our workflow more efficient. Best regards, Program Manager [ https://link.sbstck.com/redirect/e989392c-6384-4f50-9238-f462c80ed64e?j=eyJ1IjoiM3Yxd3RxIn0.pS6nfe3axVnbdKqBjOVXmoGAY01Y5n5tFxjxFZEfFWU ] Girlscript Summer of Code Feel free to reach out if you have any questions or suggestions. Let's continue to make great things happen together!  Unsubscribe https://substack.com/redirect/2/eyJlIjoiaHR0cHM6Ly9nc3NvYy5zdWJzdGFjay5jb20vYWN0aW9uL2Rpc2FibGVfZW1haWw_.2ilOYkuMaN391sSsMdnxEScnNXj0W41ik0mYIbrqMpY? subject: Even Semester - AY : 2023-24 Commencing from 01.01.2024
content: Dear Students,  Greetings!!!  *As you all are aware, t**his is to bring to your knowledge that the Even Semester of AY:2023-24, is commencing on 01.01.2024, Monday.*  *So, all the students are requested to be on campus from 01.01.2024.*  Kindly find the attached* timetable* for the *Even semester* (*2CSE)* of the *academic year 2023-24*  commencing from *01st January 2024 (Monday).*  Feel free to contact the TT committee members (Dipak Ramoliya/Arpit Bhatt) for any queries/doubts.   *A Warm Welcome to all our beloved students for on-campus studies from 01.01.2024 with lots of excitement and a smile on the face 😊*  *We are waiting for you all back on campus from the very first day of the new semester. 😊😇 *😀  *Thanks and Regards,* *RADHIKA H. content: Regards, Radhika H. Patel, Assistant Professor, Department of Information Technology, Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR), CHARUSAT,  Changa  ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: CPSQUAD CHARUSAT Date: Thu, 22 Feb 2024, 6:30 pm Subject: CP SQUAD CLUB Team Selection 2024 To: <22ce@charusat.edu.in>, <22cs@charusat.edu.in>, <22it@charusat.edu.in>, <22aiml@charusat.edu.in>, <23ce@charusat.edu.in>, <23cs@charusat.edu.in>, < 23it@charusat.edu.in>, <23aiml@charusat.edu.in>, < radhikapatel.it@charusat.ac.in> Cc: , , 21IT068 KOTAK HIRANJ MAHESHBHAI <21it068@charusat.edu.in>, 21IT011 BHATT VATSAL MAHESHKUMAR <21it011@charusat.edu.in>, <21it050@charusat.edu.in>, 21IT094 NAKUM PARTH JETHABHAI <21it094@charusat.edu.in>   Hola Coders, Hope you are doing extremely well.  CP SQUAD CLUB is excited to announce the selection process for various positions within the club. This is your chance to take on a role and make a difference in the club!  Openings: 1. Lead and Co-Lead 2. Technical Team 3. Content Team 4. Graphics and Media Team  Perks of joining the Team:  1️⃣ A chance to showcase your leadership skills, managerial skills and social skills. 2️⃣ A chance to sharpen your content creation skills and graphic design skills. 3️⃣ An opportunity to connect with peers from different institutes/departments/universities. 4️⃣ An opportunity to showcase marketing strategies, create visually appealing content, collaborate on branding, and showcase creativity. 5️⃣ You will have a good time attending an event, seminar, webinar and workshops from the industry experts. You will organize the contests, workshops, seminars too. It can indeed be a lifetime experience and memories for you. Obviously It will create a great impact on your resume too. content: Subject: Fwd: 16-Day Entrepreneurship Awareness Program To:   Dear Sir/Madam,  Turnip's *Entrepreneurship Awareness Program* is a unique course to sensitise students and faculty on important startup concepts.  The course is highly practical and follows a convenient pedagogy style with daily lessons.  *Course features*  ✅  Duration: 16 days (online, self-paced) ✅  Reduced fee: *₹295/-* ✅  *Upgraded* certificate with institute name and designation ✅  Includes course ebook + other startup resources ✅  *Graded quiz* (min 50% score required to obtain certificate) ✅  Starts immediately after registration and email verification  * View Details and Start the Course * *Please share the program details with all students and faculty*. subject: Fwd: MCQ Test for Internal Evaluation of the subject Environmental Science.
content: Evaluation of internal 30 marks, the 20 marks MCQ Test for subject Environmental Science.  FYI ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Hemangi Oza Date: Wed, Mar 13, 2024 at 10:09 AM Subject: MCQ Test for Internal Evaluation of the subject Environmental Science. To:  Dear All,    As per our subject pedagogy, we have already announced an evaluation of internal 30 marks, the 20 marks MCQ Test will be held in the last week of March 2024.    Therefore, MCQ test will be held on 30th March, 2024 (Saturday) from 10.30 AM to 11:00 AM via google form on Google class room platform.   You are requested to circulate this mail to the students.    The link of the exam will be mailed by me to the subject teacher who has taken the class. Make sure that every student has joined the Google Classroom.   Following are the instructions which all the students have to follow:   1. MCQ test will be conducted via google form on 30th March, 2024 (Saturday).  2. Link will be shared on google classroom so each student has to join the google classroom. If you have not joined, then communicate with your subject teacher and join as sson as possible.  3. MCQ test will be of 20 Marks and timings will be 30 minutes from 10:30 AM to 11:00 AM.  4. Time will set for this slot so it will be automatically closed after 11:00 AM. No students will be allowed to give the test after this time.   This will be the first and last oppertunity for giving the MCQ test for internal evaluation after this any excuses from students will not be considered, and any student will not be entertained.   Thank You   With Regards  Ms. Hemangi Oza  M. Tech Environment Engineer  Assistant Professor  Dept. of Civil Engineering  CSPIT CHARUSAT  Changa, Anand.  Mo. Sound like you? Push your skills to the next level with these hackathons 💻  Why join? We could list all the benefits, but instead, let's hear from someone who's been there. subject: MiniDrone Competition Opportunity
content: Hey there, I am writing this mail as I recently had a conversation with @Krishna Patel Ma'am about the upcoming MiniDrone competition, and she suggested that I discuss it with you.  The competition seems like a fantastic opportunity to apply our skills and knowledge in robotics and automation. I believe our combined efforts could lead to a successful outcome. It would be great to have you on board to brainstorm ideas and strategies for the competition.  Could we perhaps meet sometime this week to discuss this further? I'm keen to hear your thoughts and ideas on how we can approach this.  Looking forward to your response.  --   Karan Patel | Student  22dcs062@charusat.edu.in Hey there, I am writing this mail as I recently had a conversation with @Krishna Patel Ma'am about the upcoming MiniDrone competition, and she suggested that I discuss it with you. The competition seems like a fantastic opportunity to apply our skills and knowledge in robotics and automation. I believe our combined efforts could lead to a successful outcome. It would be great to have you on board to brainstorm ideas and strategies for the competition. Could we perhaps meet sometime this week to discuss this further? I'm keen to hear your thoughts and ideas on how we can approach this. Looking forward to your response. -- Karan Patel | Student 22dcs062@charusat.edu.in

content: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal DEPSTAR Date: Thu, 2 May 2024, 9:05 am Subject: Fwd: [👩🏻‍🎓Engineering Students] FREE 6 Weeks Live Online Internship cum Certificate Program for all branches of B. Tech and M. Tech students of 2023/2024/2025/2026/2027 passed out/passing batch | Registration Link - https://bit.ly/INDIAai To: Depstar ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Ybi Foundation Date: Thu, May 2, 2024 at 9:02 AM Subject: [👩🏻‍🎓Engineering Students] FREE 6 Weeks Live Online Internship cum Certificate Program for all branches of B. Tech and M. Tech students of 2023/2024/2025/2026/2027 passed out/passing batch | Registration Link - https://bit.ly/INDIAai To: Training Placement *Respected Sir/Ma'am,*  Greetings for the Day!  The current Global and Indian Job Market demands Engineering Graduates from any branch with essential Data Science and AI skills.  Also, the Government of India and AICTE recognized the importance of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and hence initiated various programs to promote Data Science and AI skills for Every Engineering student at college campus.  *Ybi Foundation **(Section 8 not for profit company) *is pleased to announce *6 Weeks FREE Live Online Internship Cum Certificate Program in Data Science and Artificial Intelligence* for Engineering students pursuing *B.Tech and M.Tech* of all branches and academic years.  The Highlights of this *FREE Online Internship Cum Certificate Program *     - Engineering students of all branches can apply    - No prior programming skills required    - Online live classes in Hindi + English    - Beginner to Advance Level    - 1:1 Live Doubt Resolution Session    - Hands-On Experiential Learning on Real World Projects    - Structured Study Material    - Resume Building    - Enhance student placement opportunities    - *Digitally Verified Internship Completion Certificate*   Any student of *B.Tech and M.Tech* (*Computer Science, IT, **Electrical, Electronics, Mechanical, Civil* and all other engineering branches of *2023/2024/2025/2026/2027* *passed out/passing batch* can apply.  *Program Start Date: 6th May **(Next Batch Starting Every Monday)* *Last Date to Apply: 15th June **(Rolling Admissions till June 2024)* *Duration: 6 Weeks*  *Register from below link *for any difficulty in enrollment contact* (+91) 966 798 7711*  *Registration Link: https://bit.ly/INDIAai *  *https://www.ybifoundation.org/* *Please Note : This FREE Online Internship Cum Certificate Program is Completely FREE of cost.*  If you have any query, please feel free to call or Whatsapp us at (+91) 966 798 7711 or write to us at support@ybifoundation.org  [image: FREE 6 Weeks Internship cum Certificate Program in Data Science and AI skills.png]  --  You received this message because you are subscribed to the Google Groups "Training Placement" group. subject: =?UTF-8?Q?Fwd=3A_Celebrating_=E2=80=9CWorld_Happiness_Day=E2=80=99=E2=80=99_=2D_20th?= 	=?UTF-8?Q?_March_2024_at_10=2E30_am_=2DInvitation_to_attend_the_program_=28o?= 	=?UTF-8?Q?nline=29?=
content: Dear Students,   Kindly participate.  Feel free to contact your counselors in case of any queries or doubts.  Thank you.  Regards, Radhika H. Patel, Assistant Professor, Department of Information Technology, Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR), CHARUSAT,  Changa  ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal DEPSTAR Date: Tue, 19 Mar 2024, 5:09 pm Subject: Fwd: Celebrating “World Happiness Day’’ - 20th March 2024 at 10.30 am -Invitation to attend the program (online) To: Depstar ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: AICTE(no-reply) Date: Tue, Mar 19, 2024 at 4:32 PM Subject: Celebrating “World Happiness Day’’ - 20th March 2024 at 10.30 am -Invitation to attend the program (online) To: Respected Sir/Madam,  Greetings from AICTE! International Day of Happiness is celebrated every year on 20th March. In the realm of education, fostering joyful learning experiences is paramount. When learners are engaged, curious, and content, they absorb knowledge more deeply, retain it longer, and develop a lifelong love for learning. AICTE in collaboration with YOL are celebrating the world happiness day on the *20th March 24 at 10.30 am *onwards (program attached).  This is further to the AICTE’s last notification announcing the Institutional happiness ranking as per which institutions were requested to register on www.yol.one who are also requested to track and forward a compliance status of registration of each institution. This assumes significance since this report will be sent to UN SDSN. The world happiness report is created by UN SDSN where India is rated on the 126th position out of 145 countries in the world.  Social and emotional learning has also been included in the Approval Process Handbook 2024-2027, aligning with NEP's emphasis on these. The YOL program facilitates students to practice and sharpen their social and emotional skills. Institutions implementing the UHV programs and granting 2/3 credits can integrate the happiness program from www.yol.one , allocating 1 credit to students within the same framework.  You are requested to encourage faculty members, students, staff to participate and join through link .  *Title*: *Celebrating World Happiness Day* Date & Time: 20th March, 2024 from 10:30 am onwards  *Link:*  https://aicteindia.webex.com/aicteindia/j.php?MTID=m230e9f368f8145e446879ae70654ffdc Password: 1234  *YouTube link:* https://youtube.com/live/5_d07mn_DY8?feature=share On International Day of Happiness, let us recommit to cultivating environments where happiness and joyful learning intertwine, fostering a brighter, more fulfilling future for all.  We deeply value your time and engagement.  PFA:- https://drive.google.com/file/d/1JR0B6eGr28eLlWNhVqz5zQjucN8caQ0_/view?usp=sharing   PFA:- https://drive.google.com/file/d/1TzHwSOJWUEDtz86OorCUOscfr89VhXs7/view?usp=sharing   PFA:- https://drive.google.com/file/d/1l4EB_BtW-nuJCt6JyTz1r1q48PRCHcIi/view?usp=sharing    *Regards* *Dr. Mamta Rani Agarwal* *Advisor-I & Bureau Head* *Policy & Academic Planning Bureau * *All India Council for Technical Education,* *Nelson Mandela Marg, Vasant Kunj,* *New Delhi- 110070 **Phone no. 011-29581122*  --    DISCLAIMER: The information transmitted is intended only for the person or entity to which it is addressed and may contain confidential and/or privileged material which is the intellectual property of Charotar  University of Science & Technology (CHARUSAT). Any review, retransmission, dissemination or other use of, or taking of any action in reliance upon  this information by persons or entities other than the intended recipient  is strictly prohibited. Patel, Assistant Professor, Department of Information Technology, Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR), CHARUSAT,  Changa ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Principal DEPSTAR < principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in > Date: Tue, 19 Mar 2024, 5:09 pm Subject: Fwd: Celebrating “World Happiness Day’’ - 20th March 2024 at 10.30 am -Invitation to attend the program (online) To: Depstar < depstar@charusat.ac.in > ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: AICTE(no-reply) < noreply13@aicte-india.org > Date: Tue, Mar 19, 2024 at 4:32 PM Subject: Celebrating “World Happiness Day’’ - 20th March 2024 at 10.30 am -Invitation to attend the program (online) To:  < principal.depstar@charusat.ac.in > Respected Sir/Madam, Greetings from AICTE! International Day of Happiness is celebrated every year on 20th March. In the realm of education, fostering joyful learning experiences is paramount. When learners are engaged, curious, and content, they absorb knowledge more deeply, retain it longer, and develop a lifelong love for learning. AICTE in collaboration with YOL are celebrating the world happiness day on the 20th March 24 at 10.30 am onwards (program attached). This is further to the AICTE’s last notification announcing the Institutional happiness ranking as per which institutions were requested to register on www.yol.one who are also requested to track and forward a compliance status of registration of each institution. This assumes significance since this report will be sent to UN SDSN. The world happiness report is created by UN SDSN where India is rated on the 126 th position out of 145 countries in the world. Social and emotional learning has also been included in the Approval Process Handbook 2024-2027, aligning with NEP's emphasis on these. The YOL program facilitates students to practice and sharpen their social and emotional skills. Institutions implementing the UHV programs and granting 2/3 credits can integrate the happiness program from www.yol.one , allocating 1 credit to students within the same framework. You are requested to encourage faculty members, students, staff to participate and join through link . Title : Celebrating World Happiness Day Date & Time: 20 th March, 2024 from 10:30 am onwards Link: https://aicteindia.webex.com/aicteindia/j.php?MTID=m230e9f368f8145e446879ae70654ffdc Password: 1234 YouTube link: https://youtube.com/live/5_d07mn_DY8?feature=share On International Day of Happiness, let us recommit to cultivating environments where happiness and joyful learning intertwine, fostering a brighter, more fulfilling future for all. We deeply value your time and engagement. PFA:- https://drive.google.com/file/d/1JR0B6eGr28eLlWNhVqz5zQjucN8caQ0_/view?usp=sharing PFA:- https://drive.google.com/file/d/1TzHwSOJWUEDtz86OorCUOscfr89VhXs7/view?usp=sharing PFA:- https://drive.google.com/file/d/1l4EB_BtW-nuJCt6JyTz1r1q48PRCHcIi/view?usp=sharing Regards Dr. Mamta Rani Agarwal Advisor-I & Bureau Head Policy & Academic Planning Bureau All India Council for Technical Education, Nelson Mandela Marg, Vasant Kunj, New Delhi- 110070 Phone no. 011-29581122 DISCLAIMER: The information transmitted is intended only for the person or entity to which it is addressed and may contain confidential and/or privileged material which is the intellectual property of Charotar University of Science & Technology (CHARUSAT). subject: Fwd: Knowledge Forum on Entrepreneurship and Startups
content: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Ritika Gairaula Date: Thu, Jun 13, 2024 at 1:02 PM Subject: Knowledge Forum on Entrepreneurship and Startups To: Cc: Ishan Bhatia , Urmmila Mandall < urmmila.mandall@infyni.com>, Manoj Sinha Dear Sir/Ma'am,  We are delighted to invite you to our *Knowledge Forum *event on *Entrepreneurship and Startups*, scheduled for *4 PM* on *June 22nd*. This forum aims to provide invaluable insights into starting and growing your own business, featuring expert speakers and successful entrepreneurs who will share their experiences and strategies.  Event Details:  Topic: Entrepreneurship and Startups Date: June 22, 2024 Time: 4:00 PM Mode: Online  *Join us for an engaging session where you will gain:*     - Learn the essentials of starting a business    - Discover effective funding and investment strategies    - Gain insights into scaling and growing your startup    - Participation Certificate   *About Instructor:*  *Mr Shivesh* is a serial entrepreneur and angel investor, he served in the Civil Service with the Government of India. Subsequently, he worked as Strategy Consultant with Booz & Co at their London Office.  *Specialities:* Startups, New Product / Service Development, Innovation, Strategy, Product - Market Fit, Project Development, Talent Development, Public Private Partnerships, Procurement and Business Development, Contract Management, Managing Joint Ventures, Collaborations and Split-ups and so on..   *To secure your spot, please click here to enrol:* *https://infyni.com/webinar-details/knowledge-forum-event-on-entrepreneurship-and-startups *  We look forward to your participation in this exciting event. Please confirm your attendance by replying to this email or by registering through the link.  Thank you, and we hope to see you there! content: View this post on the web at https://gssoc.substack.com/p/launching-leaderboard-achievements  Welcome to the Girlscript Summer of Code (GSSoC) 2024! We are thrilled to introduce our new and improved leaderboard where your contributions to open source can be recognized and celebrated. Here's everything you need to know about how to showcase your achievements and climb the leaderboard. Displaying Achievements 🏅 Your achievements will be proudly displayed on your public profile on the GSSoC website. This is a fantastic way to demonstrate your active participation in the open-source community. To view how your profile will look, visit the Leaderboard on the GSSoC website later today. Why Achievement Badges? GSSoC is about more than just writing code. It's about contributing to the community, whether you're a beginner or an expert. Instead of just scoring points, we want to acknowledge your contributions at various levels with badges and perks. Other people who visit your profile will be able to see how helpful you are in the open-source community by looking at your badges. So, are you ready to start earning badges? 📃 Achievement List 📃 Here's how you can earn badges and the scores you need to achieve them: Explore more details about badges: Visit our GitHub Repo [ https://link.sbstck.com/redirect/a245a139-244b-4157-930f-475b8b9fcced?j=eyJ1IjoiM3Yxd3RxIn0.pS6nfe3axVnbdKqBjOVXmoGAY01Y5n5tFxjxFZEfFWU ] Upcoming Events🥳 Event: Weekly Q&A with Program Manager Speaker: Dipali Kulshrestha Date: 31th May 7:00 PM Location: YouTube Live [ https://link.sbstck.com/redirect/0a84e82b-16e6-4b19-9889-518107609037?j=eyJ1IjoiM3Yxd3RxIn0.pS6nfe3axVnbdKqBjOVXmoGAY01Y5n5tFxjxFZEfFWU ] Stay tuned for more updates and keep coding! We will send you reminder emails. We hope this newsletter inspires you to contribute actively and achieve great heights in the Girlscript Summer of Code 2024. Happy coding and happy contributing! 🚀 Program Manager [ https://link.sbstck.com/redirect/1a18892d-8b97-4a83-b438-66bcd7b47c81?j=eyJ1IjoiM3Yxd3RxIn0.pS6nfe3axVnbdKqBjOVXmoGAY01Y5n5tFxjxFZEfFWU ] Girlscript Summer of Code 2024  Unsubscribe https://substack.com/redirect/2/eyJlIjoiaHR0cHM6Ly9nc3NvYy5zdWJzdGFjay5jb20vYWN0aW9uL2Rpc2FibGVfZW1haWw_.kGLM0K-IDrVlBmT1DZi2-fd2LzS1foWVUd5tthxpc0c? subject: Fwd: Syllabus of MA253 (DISCRETE MATHEMATICS AND ALGEBRA)
content: *Thanks and Regards,* *RADHIKA H. subject: Certification Course on "Machine Learning and Data Science: From  Beginner to Expert"
content: Dear Participants,  We are your course instructors: Dr. Sanskruti Patel and Dr. Sagar Kavaiya.  We warmly welcome you to our certification course on "Machine Learning and Data Science: From Beginner to Expert," which will commence on June 29, 2024, with the first session scheduled at 9:15 AM.  Please join the session using the following link : https://meet.google.com/wxt-mgjz-tjk  Please note that we will be using the same link for all sessions throughout the course.  To facilitate our learning and collaboration, we have created a Google Classroom. Please join the classroom using the following link: https://classroom.google.com/c/Njk3MDUzNDA1NTAw?cjc=c7fh33a  The course will be offered in a blended mode, combining theory sessions with hands-on implementation. We will be using Google Colab for the implementation exercises. Additionally, the Google Classroom will serve as a hub for sharing course resources, including notes, code, references, and more.  You will find the detailed schedule attached to this message, and it is also available in the Google Classroom.  Looking forward to an engaging and fruitful learning journey with all of you!  Best regards, Dr. Sanskruti Patel and Dr. Sagar Kavaiya -- Dr. Sanskruti Patel Associate Professor Smt. Chandaben Mohanbhai Patel Institute of Computer Applications Faculty of Computer Science and Applications Charotar University of Science and Technology Changa.  --    DISCLAIMER: The information transmitted is intended only for the person or entity to which it is addressed and may contain confidential and/or privileged material which is the intellectual property of Charotar  University of Science & Technology (CHARUSAT). subject: Fwd: Announcement - Certificate Course titled Express Yourself:  Mastering English and Public Speaking Skills
content: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Dean FOH Date: Mon, Jun 24, 2024 at 3:59 PM Subject: Announcement - Certificate Course titled Express Yourself: Mastering English and Public Speaking Skills To: Charusat Family   Dear All,    We are excited to announce a new certificate course, "*Express yourself: Mastering English and Public Speaking* *Skills*", designed to enhance your spoken English proficiency, boost your confidence, and refine your public speaking abilities.    *Course Highlights:*  ·   Interactive Sessions: Engage in dynamic activities and games to make learning fun.  ·   Daily Practice: 1 hour of immersive training every day (Mon-Fri) - 4:30 Pm onward  ·   Fees: Just 1000 INR for the entire course.  ·   Eligibility: Open exclusively to CHARUSAT students  ·   Starts from: July 1, 2024    Inform your students not to miss this opportunity to improve your communication skills in a fun and supportive environment.    Register now *(Click here to register)* and take the first step towards becoming a more confident and effective communicator!    For more details, refer to the attached poster or contact Ms. Celine Davla on 9737517553.    Best regards,     Bhaskar Pandya  --    DISCLAIMER: The information transmitted is intended only for the person or entity to which it is addressed and may contain confidential and/or privileged material which is the intellectual property of Charotar  University of Science & Technology (CHARUSAT). subject: =?utf-8?q?vansh=2C_get_an_internship_or_a_project_with_an_IIT_Professor?=  =?utf-8?q?=3A_Live_online_session_to_guide_you?=
content: Session by IIT Mandi. Know how you can get a project under the mentorship of an IIT Professor or get an Internship in an IIT.  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   Hi vansh!     We are organising a live online session titled 'How to get an internship or a project with an IIT Professor'. There is NO FEE for this event. However, we have LIMITED SEATS. Keeping this in mind, please register at earliest.     Link to register for the event: lu.ma/iitevent     Other session details:    * Date: Saturday, 20th July 2024   * Time: 6:00 - 7:00 PM   * Registration link: lu.ma/iitevent   * Fee: There is NO FEE for this event.  Limited seats available, registration on a first-come, first-served basis. Register NOW and book your seat.      The session is being offered by IIT Mandi in collaboration with Bolt IoT and Masai School. Given the challenging placement scenario this year, it’s strongly advised that you participate in this session. It will help you improve your profile and build a better portfolio and a resume.     Help us reach out to more students:  Do share this opportunity with your friends and classmates as well. You can share it with them via WhatsApp from here: Share via WhatsApp with your friends     Regards,  Rohit TS  Software Developer - Bolt IoT     Link to register for the event: lu.ma/iitevent                       Unsubscribe me vansh, get an internship or a project with an IIT Professor: Live online session to guide you Session by IIT Mandi. We are organising a live online session titled 'How to get an internship or a project with an IIT Professor'. There is NO FEE for this event. However, we have LIMITED SEATS . Keeping this in mind, please register at earliest. Link to register for the event: lu.ma/iitevent Other session details: Date: Saturday, 20th July 2024 Time: 6:00 - 7:00 PM Registration link: lu.ma/iitevent Fee: There is NO FEE for this event. Limited seats available, registration on a first-come, first-served basis. Register NOW and book your seat. The session is being offered by IIT Mandi in collaboration with Bolt IoT and Masai School.
