subject: Invitation : Doubt-solving session focused on career guidance
content: Dear Students,  I hope this message finds you well. We are pleased to invite you to an upcoming *doubt-solving session focused on career guidance*, where we aim to address any questions or concerns you may have regarding your career paths and aspirations.  *Date:* 06-07-2024, Saturday  *Duration:* 01:00 pm to 02:00 pm  *Location: *It will be shared once registration is completed.  During this session, you will have the opportunity to:     - Discuss career options and paths suitable for your interests and    strengths.    - Receive guidance on educational opportunities and skill development.    - Seek advice on navigating challenges in pursuing your career goals.    - Engage with experienced professionals who will share insights and tips.  Please come prepared with your questions and any topics you would like to discuss. We encourage active participation to make the most out of this session.  We look forward to seeing you there and assisting you in shaping your future career endeavors.  *Link for the registration:* https://forms.gle/y2BWM91gsU2iowCe7   Last date of registration is 5-07-2024, before 03:00 pm  Thank you for your understanding and cooperation. We look forward to seeing you there!  Thank you. regards Ms. Krishna Patel (Ph.D.) Assistant Professor Department of Computer Science & Engineering Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research Charotar University of Science And Technology  --    DISCLAIMER: The information transmitted is intended only for the person or entity to which it is addressed and may contain confidential and/or privileged material which is the intellectual property of Charotar  University of Science & Technology (CHARUSAT). subject: Survey based educational system
content: Dear Students,  The IIM students are conducting research on student's as well as their parent's perception about the institute.  They require the students of first-year depstar-CE, depstar - CSE,  depstar -IT fill the Google form as per following.  It is also requested for the parents of the student to fill the Parent's form given in the link below.  Write your own individual opinion and perception in the given format. Kindly refrain from giving one-word/sentence answers. Write your opinion in a minimum 3-4 sentences. We assure you that the responses will not be shared with any member of the CHARUSAT Family.  Please take note of the following:  For the question: "Check on the name of the person interviewing you." select as per followings.  ID number 1 to 57 will select "Aishwarya" 58 to 114 will select "Kishori" 115 to 171 select "Ishan" 172 to 228select "Shakshi" 229 to 285select "Netri" and the rest of ID numbers will select "Yashwanth"  Students' Google form: https://forms.gle/draVmDxFdtK55i398  Parent's Google form: https://forms.gle/vqZj9KyXkHZkkoha8  We request you all to kindly do the needful by 20 Feb 2024, 4:30 p.m  *Thanks and Regards,* *RADHIKA H. subject: Fwd: One Week STTP On AI and ROS for Robotics, 10-14 June 2024
content: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Sreekumar M Date: Sat, May 4, 2024 at 11:34 PM Subject: One Week STTP On AI and ROS for Robotics, 10-14 June 2024 To:   Dear Professors/Experts/Colleagues,    The Centre for AI, IoT, and Robotics, Dept. of Mechanical Engineering, IIITDM Kancheepuram (an Institute of National Importance fully funded by the Ministry of Education, Govt. of India) is organizing a series of short-term training programs (STTPs) every year, particularly in the robotics and allied areas. This year, the *third edition of the STTP program on “AI and ROS for Robotics: Theory and Practice” is scheduled for 10-14 June 2024*. *This program is on “Physical Mode”*. The brochure is attached herewith for your kind perusal and registration is open now.    The students and scholars under your supervision may please be encouraged to apply. content: Dear All,  We have only a few seats left for the registration for the *Certification Course on Generative AI.* Interested students kindly register at the earliest.  regards,  On Mon, Apr 1, 2024 at 4:19 PM Dr. Kirti Makwana < kirtimakwana.mba@charusat.ac.in> wrote:  > Dear Learners, > > *Generative AI is revolutionizing various industries by enabling machines > to autonomously generate content such as images, music, text, and more. *Understanding > and mastering Generative AI opens doors to endless creative possibilities > and innovative applications. With the rapid advancements in AI technology, > there is a growing demand for professionals who can harness the power of > Generative AI to drive artistic expression, enhance user experiences, and > solve complex problems. > > *Department of Computer Science and Engineering* (CSE), DEPSTAR, a > constituent institute of the Faculty of Technology and Engineering (FTE), > Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT) extends a warm > invitation to you for our upcoming *Certificate Course in Generative AI*, scheduled > from *May 13th to May 18th, 2024.* This intensive program will run for *5 > hours every day*, offering an immersive learning experience in one of the > most fascinating fields of artificial intelligence. *A resource Person > from Googel Inc. will transact the course.* > > *Generative AI Course Overview* > > *Generative AI *represents a unique convergence of creativity and > technology, empowering individuals to design algorithms capable of > producing art, music, and much more autonomously. Throughout the course, > you will delve into the fundamentals of Generative AI, gaining insights > into neural networks, deep learning architectures, and probabilistic > models. Guided by industry experts with extensive experience in AI research > and development, you will learn to leverage state-of-the-art tools and > frameworks to build your generative models. > *Key Features* > [image: image.png] > *Here are the key details of the course:* > > *Dates: *May 13th to May 18th, 2024 > *Duration: *5 hours per day > *Mode of Teaching: *Offline + Online > *Location:* Will be communicated to the registered students > *Time:* 09:10 AM Onwards > > *Registration Fees* > >    - *Rs. 3,000 *for CHARUSAT Students / Alumni Members >    - *Rs. 3,500 *for External Student Participants >    - *Rs. 5,000 *for external participants > > > We believe that this course will not only expand your understanding of > Generative AI but also equip you with practical skills that are highly > relevant in today's rapidly evolving job market. Dear All, We have only a few seats left for the registration for the Certification Course on Generative AI. Interested students kindly register at the earliest. regards, On Mon, Apr 1, 2024 at 4:19 PM Dr. Kirti Makwana < kirtimakwana.mba@charusat.ac.in > wrote: Dear Learners, Generative AI is revolutionizing various industries by enabling machines to autonomously generate content such as images, music, text, and more. Understanding and mastering Generative AI opens doors to endless creative possibilities and innovative applications. With the rapid advancements in AI technology, there is a growing demand for professionals who can harness the power of Generative AI to drive artistic expression, enhance user experiences, and solve complex problems. Department of Computer Science and Engineering (CSE), DEPSTAR, a constituent institute of the Faculty of Technology and Engineering (FTE), Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT) extends a warm invitation to you for our upcoming Certificate Course in Generative AI , scheduled from May 13th to May 18th, 2024. This intensive program will run for 5 hours every day , offering an immersive learning experience in one of the most fascinating fields of artificial intelligence. A resource Person from Googel Inc. will transact the course. Generative AI Course Overview Generative AI represents a unique convergence of creativity and technology, empowering individuals to design algorithms capable of producing art, music, and much more autonomously. Throughout the course, you will delve into the fundamentals of Generative AI, gaining insights into neural networks, deep learning architectures, and probabilistic models. Guided by industry experts with extensive experience in AI research and development, you will learn to leverage state-of-the-art tools and frameworks to build your generative models. Key Features Here are the key details of the course: Dates: May 13th to May 18th, 2024 Duration: 5 hours per day Mode of Teaching: Offline + Online Location: Will be communicated to the registered students Time: 09:10 AM Onwards Registration Fees Rs. 3,000 for CHARUSAT Students / Alumni Members Rs. 3, 5 00 for E xternal Student Participants Rs. 5,000 for external participants We believe that this course will not only expand your understanding of Generative AI but also equip you with practical skills that are highly relevant in today's rapidly evolving job market. Whether you aspire to pursue a career in digital art, music composition, gaming, or AI research, this course will provide you with the knowledge and expertise needed to succeed. To confirm your participation and reserve your spot in the course, please complete the registration process by April 30, 2024. For any questions or further information, feel free to reach out to Dr. Kirti Makwana (+91-9586861680 | kirtimakwana.mba@charusat.ac.in ) and/or Dr. Chirag Patel (M - 7016945563 | chiragpatel.dce@charusat.ac.in ). subject: CHSRUSAT_FTE_DEPSTAR_Invitation to Workshop on Web Automation Testing  Using Selenium WebDriver
content: Dear Students,  *Greetings from CHARUSAT_FTE_DEPSTAR !!!*  We are excited to announce a workshop on *"Web Automation Testing Using Selenium WebDriver"* by *Dr. Jaishree Tailor, Associate Manager at L&T Technology Services, Vadodara.* This workshop will provide valuable insights and hands-on experience in web automation testing, a crucial skill in today's software development landscape.  *Workshop Details:*     - *Date:* July 20, 2024, Saturday    - *Time:* 10:00 AM onwards    - *Venue:* Will be communicated to the registered students  *Objective:* The workshop aims to leverage awareness of industrial test automation, covering roles, methodologies, tools, and frameworks for web applications. It will focus on web automation techniques to streamline testing static web forms, including element interaction, script modularization, and unit test conversion using PyTest with Selenium and Python.  *Learning Outcomes:* By the end of this workshop, participants will be able to:     - Explain the role of software testing in application development and    differentiate between manual and test automation approaches.    - Utilize Selenium WebDriver to automate web application testing,    including element identification, interaction, and assertion.    - Develop basic test automation scripts for interacting with various web    elements (forms, dropdowns, links, etc.).    - Apply best practices for structuring and modularizing automation    scripts for maintainability and reusability.    - Convert basic automation scripts into unit test scripts using the    PyTest framework.  *Pre-requisites:* Participants are encouraged to brush up on Python syntax, function/method design in Python, and HTML form tags, attributes, and elements before the workshop. Please make sure you have Python 3.9 or above and PyCharm Community Edition installed.  *Software Requirements:*     - Python 3.9 or above: Download Here - PyCharm Community Edition: Download Here *Registration:* Please register for the workshop by *clicking here. Early registration is encouraged as seats are limited.*  Don't miss this opportunity to enhance your skills and learn from an industry expert. We look forward to your active participation.  Best regards, [image: Workshop on Web Automation.png]  --  *Dr. Kirti Makwana*  Mobile:+91-9586861680  *[image: Inline image 1]                    * ACCREDITED WITH “A+” GRADE BY NAAC, GOI  --    DISCLAIMER: The information transmitted is intended only for the person or entity to which it is addressed and may contain confidential and/or privileged material which is the intellectual property of Charotar  University of Science & Technology (CHARUSAT). Dear Students, Greetings from CHARUSAT_FTE_DEPSTAR !!! We are excited to announce a workshop on "Web Automation Testing Using Selenium WebDriver" by Dr. Jaishree Tailor, Associate Manager at L&T Technology Services, Vadodara. This workshop will provide valuable insights and hands-on experience in web automation testing, a crucial skill in today's software development landscape. Workshop Details: Date: July 20, 2024, Saturday Time: 10:00 AM onwards Venue: Will be communicated to the registered students Objective: The workshop aims to leverage awareness of industrial test automation, covering roles, methodologies, tools, and frameworks for web applications. It will focus on web automation techniques to streamline testing static web forms, including element interaction, script modularization, and unit test conversion using PyTest with Selenium and Python. Learning Outcomes: By the end of this workshop, participants will be able to: Explain the role of software testing in application development and differentiate between manual and test automation approaches. Utilize Selenium WebDriver to automate web application testing, including element identification, interaction, and assertion. Develop basic test automation scripts for interacting with various web elements (forms, dropdowns, links, etc.). Apply best practices for structuring and modularizing automation scripts for maintainability and reusability. Convert basic automation scripts into unit test scripts using the PyTest framework. Pre-requisites: Participants are encouraged to brush up on Python syntax, function/method design in Python, and HTML form tags, attributes, and elements before the workshop. Please make sure you have Python 3.9 or above and PyCharm Community Edition installed. Software Requirements: Python 3.9 or above: Download Here PyCharm Community Edition: Download Here Registration: Please register for the workshop by clicking here. Early registration is encouraged as seats are limited. Don't miss this opportunity to enhance your skills and learn from an industry expert. We look forward to your active participation. subject: Fwd: CIS 2024: Submission Deadline Extended
content: Good opportunity to target papers.  From: Microsoft CMT Date: Fri, Jun 28, 2024 at 11:55 AM Subject: CIS 2024: Submission Deadline Extended To:  Dear,  It is for your information that submission deadline for CIS 2024 extended till July 20, 2024.  5th Congress on Intelligent Systems (CIS 2024), scheduled for September 4-5, 2024 in association with Liverpool Hope University, U.K. This event is technically sponsored by the Soft Computing Research Society and IEEE Student Branch. CIS 2024 will feature keynote speakers from esteemed institutions, including Liverpool Hope University, U.K., the Norwegian University of Science and Technology - NTNU, Norway, and Zero Code Learning.  Please find details of CIS 2024 here: Website: CIS 2024 (https://scrs.in/conference/cis2024) Submission Link: https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/CIS2024 Conference Name: 5th Congress on Intelligent Systems (CIS 2024), Date: September 04-05, 2024 Host: CHRIST (Deemed to be University), Bengaluru, Co-Host: Liverpool Hope University, U.K Technical Sponsor: Soft Computing Research Society, New Delhi Academic Partner: Cyber-Physical Systems Laboratory (CPS Lab), Norwegian University of Science and Technology - NTNU, Norway, IEEE Student Chapter  Keynote Speakers: Prof. Atulya Nagar, PRO VICE CHANCELLOR (RESEARCH), Liverpool Hope University, U.K. Prf. Robin T. Bye, Norwegian University of Science and Technology - NTNU, Norway Prof. Ottar Laurits Osen, Norwegian University of Science and Technology - NTNU, Norway Dr. Vijander Singh, Norwegian University of Science and Technology - NTNU, Norway Dr. Ogbonnaya Anicho, Senior Lecturer in Computer Science, Liverpool Hope University, U.K. Mr. Gaurav Gupta, Platform Head, Zero Code Learning  Thanks & Regards CIS 2024https://scrs.in/conference/cis2024      To stop receiving conference emails, you can check the 'Do not send me conference email' box from your User Profile. subject: Request to Post Queries on GitHub Discussions for Better Support
content: Attention Required: Posting Queries on GitHub Discussions  Hey,  To streamline our process of addressing queries and to ensure that everyone can benefit from the answers, we kindly request that all queries be posted on our GitHub Discussions page instead of via email.  Please post your questions and concerns in the Q&A category of our GitHub Discussions at the following link: [GitHub Discussions - Q&A](https://7ro79.r.sp1-brevo.net/mk/cl/f/sh/7nVU1aA2nfsTSejkWyQjS8qYLOTPzzo/9CIRI44sP8ZQ).  Using GitHub Discussions will help us:  - Solve everyone's queries more efficiently as the GSSoC team will be actively monitoring the page. - Keep a track of all queries and responses for future reference. - Avoid repeated questions, as others will be able to see previously answered queries.  We appreciate your cooperation and look forward to assisting you on the GitHub platform.  Best regards, Saksham Shandilya Community Manager https://7ro79.r.sp1-brevo.net/mk/cl/f/sh/7nVU1aA2nfuMSBF3VXfBUVAMVkyCjwK/JgukOZpzSYIa We appreciate your cooperation and look forward to assisting you on the GitHub platform.͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ Attention Required: Posting Queries on GitHub Discussions Hey, To streamline our process of addressing queries and to ensure that everyone can benefit from the answers, we kindly request that all queries be posted on our GitHub Discussions page instead of via email. subject: Fwd: UNICEF's Exciting Opportunity for AI-Powered Job Search
content: [image: Logo]  Dear Thakkar ji,  Greetings from UNICEF India!  As you know UNICEF is a United Nations Organisation and works in 190+ countries for children and youth. UNICEF has been working in India since Independence and works closely with central and state governments through the nodal Ministry of Women and Child Development. Four years ago, UNICEF set up a new initiative called YuWaah, which is a partnership platform with a mission to enable the youth to realise their potential. Under the YuWaah initiative, UNICEF has signed Letters of Intent with the Ministry of Education, the Ministry of Skill Development and Entrepreneurship, Ministry of Labour and Employment to name a few.  Thank you for participating in our recent survey on the needs of college students. Through your feedback, and other college representatives, we were able to observe a significant interest in job support and career guidance. Responding to this,*we are initiating specialised programmes to equip students with job-ready skills through a special 3-day AI Bootcamp from 9-11 March, 10-11 AM.*  *Your institution is one of the few that we are reaching out to for this opportunity.*  This virtual seminar series will be free of cost and empower students to become *JOB READY* by learning how to use Artificial Intelligence in their job search journey. Experts will guide participants in utilising new digital tools like ChatGPT and Gemini for resume building and interview preparation.  You can share this poster digitally, or in print, within your network of college students through emails, WhatsApp, and other channels along with this message:  Download the poster HERE. -----------------------------------------------------------------------------  *Dear Students,*  *UNICEF invites you to become a part of an exclusive learning opportunity that could transform your career journey! Join a series of insightful workshops on how you can become JOB READY by learning how to use Artificial Intelligence in your job search journey.*  *In today's competitive job market, mastering Artificial Intelligence is a game-changer. This workshop is designed to equip you with the skills needed to leverage AI in your job search.*  *Register today: * https://unicef.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_MmrFDNHDTpiY3dRCCtgn1Q#/registration *Check out the poster for more details!* -----------------------------------------------------------------------------  We would like to hear from you on this initiative. Do let us know if you have any suggestions on any topics that you would like us to cover in subsequent seminars conducted by YuWaah at UNICEF.    *Warm Regards, Abhishek Gupta* COO YuWaah at UNICEF    Want to change how you receive these emails? You can update your preferences or unsubscribe This email was sent to hod.cse@charusat.ac.in *why did I get this?* unsubscribe from this list update subscription preferences UNICEF · New Delhi 110003 · New Delhi, Delhi 110003 · India  --  You received this message because you are subscribed to the Google Groups "Depstar_CSE" group. subject: TheHackersMeetup CTF Solutions
content: Hello Hackers!  Here are the solutions for all the challenges as promised :) I have zipped and attached all the necessary files for you to reproduce the challenges locally. These are all the intended solutions. There are other unintended ways as well that we hadn't taken into consideration. Well done if you managed to solve a challenge with a new way that is not mentioned here. Reach out to Het Soni (21cs068@charusat.edu.in, +91 95109 56552) for any queries regarding the CTF.   ** Welcome* Solution: You had to visit the /robots.txt file on the same domain where the CTF was hosted.   * *I can't SEEEEE IT* Solution: From the source code of the page you can see it is fetching the flag from a remote API. Check the Network activity with inspect when you click the get flag button.   * *Secure Login* Solution: You can edit frontend html from inspect. Remove 'disabled' from all html form elements to enter text into the fields. Entering default credentials 'admin:password' and pressing the login button fetched the flag but didn't display on the front end. You again had to see the network activity and check the response from the remote API.   * *Encoding is not encryption!* Challenge: VEhNe0NyeXB0MEJAYnl9 Solution: Base64 encoded string.   * *Stupid Chemistry* Challenge: 39 EA 1 6 2 M 53 16 TR 39 Solution: Periodic Table cipher - dcode.fr/atomic-number-substitution   ** QR Busted!* Solution: QR codes are in a pattern. Fill in the missing two corners by copying the top right corner and scan it for the solution.   ** Find me if you can* Challenge: "Co-lead of The Hackers Meetup, Harshiv Kinariwala doesn't follow security policies and posts company secrets on social media! Can you believe that! Find that secret to get the flag." Solution: twitter.com/h_kinariwala   * *The Third Eye* Solution: A mp3 file is given. Use tools like audacity or skel to visualize it. It was Spectrogram Stegnography. Many have submitted the flag correctly but you were supposed to replace whitespaces with an underscore ( _ ).   ** RUN ME* Solution: The problem category was pwn where you are given an executable and you have to understand it's nature and logic and exploit it. Here in the given linux executable, you have to brute force the inputs by creating a local bash script that would input numbers one by one and output the correct number that is being accepted. Check the attached script to understand the logic.   Thank you everyone who participated. Happy Hacking.  --    DISCLAIMER: The information transmitted is intended only for the person or entity to which it is addressed and may contain confidential and/or privileged material which is the intellectual property of Charotar  University of Science & Technology (CHARUSAT). Any review, retransmission, dissemination or other use of, or taking of any action in reliance upon  this information by persons or entities other than the intended recipient  is strictly prohibited. If you are not the intended recipient, or the  employee, or agent responsible for delivering the message to the intended  recipient and/or if you have received this in error, please contact the  sender and delete the material from the computer or device. CHARUSAT does  not take any liability or responsibility for any malicious codes/software  and/or viruses/Trojan horses that may have been picked up during the  transmission of this message. By opening and solely relying on the contents  or part thereof this message, and taking action thereof, the recipient  relieves the CHARUSAT of all the liabilities including any damages done to  the recipient's pc/laptop/peripherals and other communication devices due  to any reason. subject: Fwd: How to simplify your software architecture
content: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: David at Cockroach Labs Date: Thu, Jun 27, 2024 at 10:31 PM Subject: How to simplify your software architecture To:   New episode — Big Ideas in App Architecture. [image: Listen now.] Hey Ronak,  Modernizing database infrastructure can solve more than just data problems. It can also simplify your software architecture and the way your engineering organization works.  In this episode, I sit down with my colleague Rob Reid to discuss the importance of architectural simplification through proven patterns, real-world examples, and practical use cases.  Join as we discuss:     - The benefits of simplifying your data architecture    - Why you should think of regulations as part of your architecture    - How in some cases, running a database across three data centers can be    cheaper than two    - What to know about selecting the right database for your use case  Listen now Or wherever you get your podcasts:  Apple Podcasts | Spotify | YouTube David Joy Host, Big Ideas in App Architecture © 2024 Cockroach Labs Inc. 125 W 25th St. 11th Floor, New York, NY 10001  Join our community: Unsubscribe // Privacy Policy --    DISCLAIMER: The information transmitted is intended only for the person or entity to which it is addressed and may contain confidential and/or privileged material which is the intellectual property of Charotar  University of Science & Technology (CHARUSAT). subject: Shepreneur - A stall showcase competition on 7th March 2024
content: Dear Students,  Greetings!!!  The *Women's Development Cell of CHARUSAT *will organize a *stall showcase* on *International Women's Day on 7th March 2024*. It is for all female students/faculty of CHARUSAT, where they can grab a chance to show their talents as well as entrepreneurial skills. There are certain activities in which girls can participate as per their wish; they will be provided a stall on the central lawn where they can sell things which are made out of their creativity.  *No. of Group(s):- Max. 03 per Department(CSPIT/DEPSTAR) /Institute *  *Entry for participants per group-Min 02 and Max 05*  *For Female Faculty: - Only 01 Group per Department(CSPIT/DEPSTAR) /Institute (participant per group min 02 and Max 05) *  *Registration Fees: 500 /- per group* (payable to respective WDC coordinator in cash)  *One Female candidate must be required in each group*, and registration should be in the name of a *female only. *  The following event(s) are scheduled from 12:00 p.m. onwards.  *1. Art & Craft: *     You can sell any piece of art or craft like cards or wall art, etc...Anything that is handmade using material like paper or threads or any other material is allowed.  *2. Quilling and Handmade Jewellery: *     You can make jewellery using quilling, pearls, beads, stones or any other material and sell them at the appropriate price.  *3. Nail Art, Tattoos, Mehendi: *     Anyone who is an expert in these three things can have a live audience to show their talents. Kindly bring some samples with you to help you attract your audience.  *4. Paintings & Drawings:*     Anyone who is an expert in paintings, drawings and sketches is welcome to sell their masterpieces. Live sketching is also an option.  *5. Fashion Design:*     You can show your talent by designing clothes of your own. The patches made of thread work or any fashion-related ideas are welcomed.  *6. Food Stall:*     Food is one of the most basic attractions, so anyone who loves cooking can have a food stall with all different varieties. You will have to bring all the required ingredients by yourself.  *7. One Minute Games: *     Games are all about fun. You can come up with fancy ideas for little games.  Things required should be arranged by you.  If you want to participate in the stall showcase competition, book your spot with your departmental WDC coordinator faculty. You need to give a 500 registration fee to your respective department faculty.   *CE - Sachi Joshi * *CSE - Bansari Patel * *IT - Ritika Jani*  *Thanks & Regards,* *Bansari Patel* *Department of Computer Science & Engineering,* *Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR),* *Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT)* Regards, Radhika H. Dear Students, Greetings!!! The Women's Development Cell of CHARUSAT will organize a stall showcase on International Women's Day on 7th March 2024 . It is for all female students/faculty of CHARUSAT , where they can grab a chance to show their talents as well as entrepreneurial skills . There are certain activities in which girls can participate as per their wish; they will be provided a stall on the central lawn where they can sell things which are made out of their creativity. No. of Group(s):- Max. 03 per Department(CSPIT/DEPSTAR) /Institute Entry for participants per group-Min 02 and Max 05 For Female Faculty: - Only 01 Group per Department(CSPIT/DEPSTAR) /Institute (participant per group min 02 and Max 05) Registration Fees: 500 /- per group (payable to respective WDC coordinator in cash) One Female candidate must be required in each group , and registration should be in the name of a female only. The following event(s) are scheduled from 12:00 p.m. onwards. 1. Art & Craft: You can sell any piece of art or craft like cards or wall art, etc...Anything that is handmade using material like paper or threads or any other material is allowed. 2. Quilling and Handmade Jewellery: You can make jewellery using quilling, pearls, beads, stones or any other material and sell them at the appropriate price. 3. Nail Art, Tattoos, Mehendi: Anyone who is an expert in these three things can have a live audience to show their talents. Kindly bring some samples with you to help you attract your audience. 4. Paintings & Drawings: Anyone who is an expert in paintings, drawings and sketches is welcome to sell their masterpieces. Live sketching is also an option. 5. Fashion Design: You can show your talent by designing clothes of your own. The patches made of thread work or any fashion-related ideas are welcomed. 6. Food Stall: Food is one of the most basic attractions, so anyone who loves cooking can have a food stall with all different varieties. You will have to bring all the required ingredients by yourself. 7. One Minute Games: Games are all about fun. You can come up with fancy ideas for little games. Things required should be arranged by you. If you want to participate in the stall showcase competition, book your spot with your departmental WDC coordinator faculty. You need to give a 500 registration fee to your respective department faculty. CE - Sachi Joshi CSE - Bansari Patel IT - Ritika Jani Thanks & Regards, Bansari Patel Department of Computer Science & Engineering, Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR), Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT) Regards, Radhika H. Patel, Assistant Professor, Department of Information Technology, Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR), CHARUSAT,  Changa DISCLAIMER: The information transmitted is intended only for the person or entity to which it is addressed and may contain confidential and/or privileged material which is the intellectual property of Charotar University of Science & Technology (CHARUSAT). subject: Fwd: Scholarship Opportunity in AI (Artificial intelligence) for  Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research students
content: Students learn to build hands-on AI projects. Earn a certificate and an internship upon completion.  Dear all    I want to express my gratitude for the support you provided in reaching out to students during the past few months. Professors like you have gone above and beyond to support students not only with their coursework but also helping them learn the latest technology beyond what is taught in regular course curriculum. We appreciate you for this.    Some time back we launched Artificial Intelligence (AI) training and have been thrilled with the response. In just a short amount of time, hundreds of students have enrolled. Especially with the launch of ChatGPT, AI is becoming increasingly pervasive across all industries, from healthcare and finance to entertainment and transportation.    Our AI training and internship program offers students the necessary skills to secure high-paying jobs in this field. Considering this, we are launching a scholarship and internship program for our AI training and internship. Please share this opportunity with your students.   What is the Artificial Intelligence (AI) scholarship and internship program?     - As part of this program, the qualifying students of Devang Patel    Institute of Advance Technology and Research can *join the Artificial    Intelligence (AI) online video training at an 80% discount.* While the    regular fee of the training is Rs.8,600/-, the qualifying students can get    it at just Rs.1,750/-.     - Students have to visit https://info.boltiot.com/aischolarship to answer the scholarship test.   What are some of the activities that students will perform as part of this AI training?     - Learn concepts of Artificial Intelligence (AI) from the basics. No    previous knowledge is required.    - Learn programming languages like Python, HTML and Javascript.    - During the training, we will be available to solve any doubts or    queries.    - Students will build 6 different hands-on projects, such as Their own    ChatGPT, AI Recipe generator, AI Software coding helper, AI Image Generator    and many more...    - They will also build innovative Artificial Intelligence (AI) projects    by applying the learnings of the training in their field.   Why should the students avail this scholarship?     - This four weeks of online video training is *excellent for those who    want to start with Artificial Intelligence (AI)* because it teaches them    to build projects from the basics.     - *Certificate:* upon completion of the training, which can be submitted    as part of university rules as well as during the job application process.     - *Work on industrial projects: *The students will work on the most    popular AI Platform by Open AI. The same platform is the base for ChatGPT    and is used by thousands of MNCs across the globe.     - *Guaranteed internship upon training **completion: *This internship    certificate can be submitted to the college if the university rules require    them to do so.   Other critical points:     - *The option of full refund:* In case the students are not happy with    the training offered to them, then they can get a full refund as per the    refund policy. This ensures that there is no risk for students or the    faculty involved in the process.     - *Lifetime access:* Students can register now and start the training    after the exams or at any other time. They can also take a break in between.     - Link to answer the scholarship quiz:    https://info.boltiot.com/aischolarship The last date to avail the scholarship is Tuesday, 20th of February 2024.    My team and I are excited to teach Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research students about Artificial Intelligence (AI). If you have any questions, please reply to this email or call us at (+91)8881197198 and press 4 to speak with us. I'm happy to provide any further information you need.    Regards, Rohit TS Software Developer - Bolt IoT  Bolt IoT (Inventrom Private Limited), 79, 11th Cross Rd, Binnamangala, Indiranagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560038, India, (+91)8881197198  Unsubscribe Manage preferences --    DISCLAIMER: The information transmitted is intended only for the person or entity to which it is addressed and may contain confidential and/or privileged material which is the intellectual property of Charotar  University of Science & Technology (CHARUSAT). Any review, retransmission, dissemination or other use of, or taking of any action in reliance upon  this information by persons or entities other than the intended recipient  is strictly prohibited. If you are not the intended recipient, or the  employee, or agent responsible for delivering the message to the intended  recipient and/or if you have received this in error, please contact the  sender and delete the material from the computer or device. CHARUSAT does  not take any liability or responsibility for any malicious codes/software  and/or viruses/Trojan horses that may have been picked up during the  transmission of this message. By opening and solely relying on the contents  or part thereof this message, and taking action thereof, the recipient  relieves the CHARUSAT of all the liabilities including any damages done to  the recipient's pc/laptop/peripherals and other communication devices due  to any reason. subject: Fwd: Invitation for Participation in Student Workshop on E-Yantra,  Robotics Workshop (Only for Students)
content: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Workshop EC Date: Sun, Apr 7, 2024 at 10:55 PM Subject: Invitation for Participation in Student Workshop on E-Yantra, Robotics Workshop (Only for Students) To:  *Explore the World of Robotics with E-Yantra Robotics Workshop*  *Dear Students,*  It is with great pleasure that we extend our cordial *invitation to you to participate in the upcoming workshop* titled "*E-Yantra Robotics Workshop*, *(Only for Students)*" organized by the *Department of Electronics and Communication Engineering at Indus University,* Ahmedabad. This workshop, conducted under the auspices of the "e-Yantra Lab Setup Initiative (eLSI) funded by *IIT Bombay,"* is scheduled to take place on *April 13th, 2024.*  The workshop is tailored for engineering students and promises to deliver enriching hands-on sessions centered around Robotics. Following is the key contents that you will learn through this workshop     - *Introduction to Robotics: *Understanding principles, applications,    and significance.    - *Embedded Systems Fundamentals: *Role in robotics and integration into    real-world applications.    - *e-Yantra Robotics Kits Overview: *Understanding components and    capabilities for research and education.    - *Hands-on Sessions: *Direct interaction with robotics hardware and    software.    - *Programming Skills:* Coding for microcontrollers, sensors, and    algorithm implementation.    - *Problem-Solving: *Developing abilities to design, build, and    troubleshoot robotic systems.    - *Teamwork and Collaboration*: Working together on tasks to foster    communication and teamwork.    - *Project Implementation:* Applying knowledge and skills to solve    specific problems or tasks.  Supported by the *Ministry of Education, Government of India, under the National Mission on Education through ICT (NMEICT)*, e-Yantra is dedicated to empowering educators with practical skills in robotics, thereby fostering innovation and problem-solving capabilities.  We are excited to provide you with the following details regarding the workshop:  Workshop Details:     - Title: E-Yantra Robotics Workshop    - Date: April 13th, 2024    - Time: 10:00 AM to 4:00 PM    - Venue: 2nd Floor, Bhanwar Building, Indus University  Note: Registration via the provided link is mandatory for workshop participation, and a* registration fee of Rs. 250/*- applies. Participants will receive certificates upon completion.  Registration Link: https://forms.gle/6ZEACoDgHbG7kbQm9  *Payment Link: * https://pay.webfront.in/webfront/#/payment/webfrontpage/indus-university/single/6484  Registration QR Code: [image: Untitled 1.png]  For any inquiries or further information, please do not hesitate to contact Dr. Divyangna Gandhi, Assistant Professor at Indus University, via email at workshop.ec@indusuni.ac.in.  Your presence and participation will undoubtedly enhance the workshop's value, and we eagerly anticipate your involvement. We kindly request your assistance in circulating this invitation among your friends, colleagues, and fellow students. This workshop, conducted under the auspices of the "e-Yantra Lab Setup Initiative (eLSI) funded by IIT Bombay," is scheduled to take place on April 13th, 2024. The workshop is tailored for engineering students and promises to deliver enriching hands-on sessions centered around Robotics. Following is the key contents that you will learn through this workshop Introduction to Robotics: Understanding principles, applications, and significance. Embedded Systems Fundamentals: Role in robotics and integration into real-world applications. e-Yantra Robotics Kits Overview: Understanding components and capabilities for research and education. Hands-on Sessions: Direct interaction with robotics hardware and software. Programming Skills: Coding for microcontrollers, sensors, and algorithm implementation. Problem-Solving: Developing abilities to design, build, and troubleshoot robotic systems. Teamwork and Collaboration : Working together on tasks to foster communication and teamwork. Project Implementation: Applying knowledge and skills to solve specific problems or tasks. Supported by the Ministry of Education, Government of India, under the National Mission on Education through ICT (NMEICT) , e-Yantra is dedicated to empowering educators with practical skills in robotics, thereby fostering innovation and problem-solving capabilities. We are excited to provide you with the following details regarding the workshop: Workshop Details: Title: E-Yantra Robotics Workshop Date: April 13th, 2024 Time: 10:00 AM to 4:00 PM Venue: 2nd Floor, Bhanwar Building, Indus University Note: Registration via the provided link is mandatory for workshop participation, and a registration fee of Rs. 250/ - applies. Participants will receive certificates upon completion. Your presence and participation will undoubtedly enhance the workshop's value, and we eagerly anticipate your involvement. We kindly request your assistance in circulating this invitation among your friends, colleagues, and fellow students. Thank you for considering this invitation, and we look forward to welcoming you to the workshop. -- With Regards, Electronics & Communication Engineering Department IITE,INDUS UNIVERSITY Rancharda via Shilaj, Ahmedabad-382115 L: +91-2764 260277 / 78 / 79  Ext: 3 325 Website: https://www.indusuni.ac.in DISCLAIMER: The information transmitted is intended only for the person or entity to which it is addressed and may contain confidential and/or privileged material which is the intellectual property of Charotar University of Science & Technology (CHARUSAT). Enhance your chances of securing high-paying job and internship opportunities in AI development  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   Hi vansh!     We are glad to invite you for a live online session on 'Getting Jobs and Internships in the domain of AI (­Artificial Intelligence) development'. Keeping this in mind, please register at the earliest.     Link to register for the event: lu.ma/iitevent     Other session details:    * Date: Saturday, 13th July 2024   * Time: 6:00 - 7:00 PM   * Registration link: lu.ma/iitevent   * Fee: There is NO FEE for this event. content: Hello Vansh Malani,  Thank you for registering for the MathWorks Minidrone Competition India 2024. This email includes the details on how to install your complimentary license for use in the MathWorks Minidrone Competition India 2024, how to access the simulation model for Round 1 of the competition, and how and when to submit your entry for Round 1.   License details: License Number: 41223329 Activation Key: 11945-55162-13602-06534-11310  Submit models by 5 PM, 14-Aug-2024 ET. Round 2 qualifiers notified by 5 PM, 04-Sept-2024 ET at Indian Institute Of Science, Bangalore, Karnataka- 560012, India on 27-28 Sept-2024. Late entries will be disqualified. All the models must be submitted by email to minidronecompetition@mathworks.com.  To use MATLAB software you need to associate your MathWorks account with a license, download the software, install the software, and finally activate the software. Please forward this email to additional team members and ask them to follow the same process as above.    Follow our Instagram channel @matlab_students for your daily dose of inspiration, tips and tricks, and resources tailored specifically for students. Don't forget to let us know how you're using MATLAB & Simulink. Tag us on Instagram @matlab_students.  Link to License  If you have not yet created a MathWorks account, you can do so here: https://www.mathworks.com/mwaccount/register  Once you have a MathWorks account, you need to associate it with a license. Your activation key is included in this email and is required to complete the association process. Instructions for associating with a license are available here: http://www.mathworks.com/matlabcentral/answers/102871  Download and Install  Once you are associated with a license you need to download the software. Download instructions are available here: http://www.mathworks.com/matlabcentral/answers/98268  The installation will begin as soon as the download is complete.  Activate your Software  Once the software is installed MATLAB will attempt to activate itself. You will be required to enter your MathWorks account credentials again for activation. If the software does not automatically attempt to activate, you will need to launch the activation client: http://www.mathworks.com/matlabcentral/answers/99457-how-do-i-activate-matlab  In some setups, such as one where a firewall is in place or a proxy is filtering all network activity, you may need to activate MATLAB manually. Instructions for manual activation can be found here: http://www.mathworks.com/matlabcentral/answers/105854  Simulation Round Details:    You can access parrotMinidroneCompetition (the model to be used for competition) after installing the Simulink Support Package for Parrot Minidrones from Add-Ons. You can use the following link to install the Support Package: https://www.mathworks.com/help/supportpkg/parrot/ug/install-support-for-parrot-minidrone.html    PLEASE NOTE:  If you are using MATLAB R2023b and later versions, run the parrotMinidroneCompetition project by entering the following command at the MATLAB command prompt:  openExample('parrot/ColorDetectionLandingOfParrotMinidroneExample');  For MATLAB R2023a or earlier versions, run the parrotMinidroneCompetition project with the command:  parrotMinidroneCompetitionStart;  The teams are recommended to go through the ‘Rules and Guidelines’ located on the MathWorks Minidrone Competitions homepage: https://www.mathworks.com/academia/student-competitions/minidrones.html  Best Regards,   MathWorks Student Competition Program   minidronecompetition@mathworks.com   ref:!00Di00Ha1u.!5003q01fRFd7:ref Hello Vansh Malani, Thank you for registering for the MathWorks Minidrone Competition India 2024. This email includes the details on how to install your complimentary license for use in the MathWorks Minidrone Competition India 2024, how to access the simulation model for Round 1 of the competition, and how and when to submit your entry for Round 1. License details: License Number: 41223329 Activation Key: 11945-55162-13602-06534-11310 Submit models by 5 PM, 14-Aug-2024 ET. Round 2 qualifiers notified by 5 PM, 04-Sept-2024 ET at Indian Institute Of Science, Bangalore, Karnataka- 560012, India on 27-28 Sept-2024. Late entries will be disqualified. All the models must be submitted by email to minidronecompetition@mathworks.com. To use MATLAB software you need to associate your MathWorks account with a license, download the software, install the software, and finally activate the software. Please forward this email to additional team members and ask them to follow the same process as above. Follow our Instagram channel @matlab_students for your daily dose of inspiration, tips and tricks, and resources tailored specifically for students. Don't forget to let us know how you're using MATLAB & Simulink. Tag us on Instagram @matlab_students. Link to License If you have not yet created a MathWorks account, you can do so here: https://www.mathworks.com/mwaccount/register Once you have a MathWorks account, you need to associate it with a license. Your activation key is included in this email and is required to complete the association process. Instructions for associating with a license are available here: http://www.mathworks.com/matlabcentral/answers/102871 Download and Install Once you are associated with a license you need to download the software. Download instructions are available here: http://www.mathworks.com/matlabcentral/answers/98268 The installation will begin as soon as the download is complete. Activate your Software Once the software is installed MATLAB will attempt to activate itself. You will be required to enter your MathWorks account credentials again for activation. If the software does not automatically attempt to activate, you will need to launch the activation client: http://www.mathworks.com/matlabcentral/answers/99457-how-do-i-activate-matlab In some setups, such as one where a firewall is in place or a proxy is filtering all network activity, you may need to activate MATLAB manually. Instructions for manual activation can be found here: http://www.mathworks.com/matlabcentral/answers/105854 Simulation Round Details: You can access parrotMinidroneCompetition (the model to be used for competition) after installing the Simulink Support Package for Parrot Minidrones from Add-Ons. You can use the following link to install the Support Package: https://www.mathworks.com/help/supportpkg/parrot/ug/install-support-for-parrot-minidrone.html PLEASE NOTE: If you are using MATLAB R2023b and later versions, run the parrotMinidroneCompetition project by entering the following command at the MATLAB command prompt: openExample('parrot/ColorDetectionLandingOfParrotMinidroneExample'); For MATLAB R2023a or earlier versions, run the parrotMinidroneCompetition project with the command: parrotMinidroneCompetitionStart; The teams are recommended to go through the ‘Rules and Guidelines’ located on the MathWorks Minidrone Competitions homepage: https://www.mathworks.com/academia/student-competitions/minidrones.html Best Regards, MathWorks Student Competition Program minidronecompetition@mathworks.com ref:!00Di00Ha1u.!5003q01fRFd7:ref

subject: Important- Online Quiz of Civil Part ME145
content: Dear Students,  An online quiz is planned for you all for Civil Part of ME145 subject. Please make sure you attempt this quiz as marks shall be counted in your internal evaluation (2.5 marks).  *Details are:*     - *Date: *Tomorrow; Friday, April 12th, 2024    - *Time:* 9:30 PM    - *Duration:* 15 minutes    - *Syllabus: *Module 11 (Introduction to surveying) and 12 (Elements of    building construction)  *How to Take the Quiz:*     - Open this link at sharp 9:28 PM Link:    https://forms.gle/GSmKbyB3rCyKNFqLA    - *Respective CRs are requested to forward this link to your class and    remind them once before quiz time.*  Tip: Add reminders in your Google calendars ( https://calendar.app.google/Ex8ZA8bGQ529XDU8A)  If you have any queries, let me know.  Regards, --  *Bhargav Shobhana* *Assistant Professor* *Civil Engineering Department* Chandubhai S. content: ****************************************** Take your hackathon game to the next level ******************************************  Hey Devposters! subject: Achievement in Khel Mahakumbh State level Taekwondo Tournament.
content: Dear All,  Greeting of CHARUSAT Sports   Report on Pankti Akbari Achievement in Khel Mahakumbh-2024 State level Taekwondo Tournament. We are thrilled to announce that Pankti Akbari(23CS001) a student of the Computer Science Engineering department at the Chandubhai S. Patel Institute of Technology, affiliated with Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT), has demonstrated outstanding prowess in Taekwondo.  Pankti secured the 1st place at the district level Khel Mahakumbh Taekwondo Tournament held in Surat. Building on this remarkable performance, she went on to achieve a Gold Medal at the State Level tournament on 16 May, 2024  Her dedication, hard work, and exceptional skill have not only brought her personal accolades but have also made our university proud. We extend our heartiest congratulations to Pankti Akbari for this significant achievement and wish her continued success in all her future endeavours.   Congratulations, Pankti!  CHARUSAT - Proud to Nurture Champions    -- Dr.Pritesh Patel Assistant Director of Physical Education and Sports CHARUSAT Physical Education and Sports Section (A constituent of CHARUSAT) *Accredited with "Grade A+" by NAAC, GOI* *Accredited with Centre of Excellence by GOG* Landline No: 02697-265036 Mobile : 95582 95583 -- 97142 96999  --    DISCLAIMER: The information transmitted is intended only for the person or entity to which it is addressed and may contain confidential and/or privileged material which is the intellectual property of Charotar  University of Science & Technology (CHARUSAT). Any review, retransmission, dissemination or other use of, or taking of any action in reliance upon  this information by persons or entities other than the intended recipient  is strictly prohibited. If you are not the intended recipient, or the  employee, or agent responsible for delivering the message to the intended  recipient and/or if you have received this in error, please contact the  sender and delete the material from the computer or device. CHARUSAT does  not take any liability or responsibility for any malicious codes/software  and/or viruses/Trojan horses that may have been picked up during the  transmission of this message. By opening and solely relying on the contents  or part thereof this message, and taking action thereof, the recipient  relieves the CHARUSAT of all the liabilities including any damages done to  the recipient's pc/laptop/peripherals and other communication devices due  to any reason.
